loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio, es casado, vive con tres nietos, su esposa, tambien con la esposa de uno de sus hijos, quien se encarga de cuidar de los niños, Porfirio se dedica a la venta de ropa, tiene 20 años en el negocio, el horario es de 6:00am hasta las 2:00pm, tiene bastante experiencia, ya que inicio muy joven.
Él necesita invertir en la compra de pantalones, para hombre y mujer, por eso solicita un préstamo que le permita realizar la compra, esta inversión le ayudara para mejorar su inventario y tener más variedad para satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes.
Su aspiración como comerciante, es tener su propia Boutique, con mas orden en la mercadería para atraer a mas clientela.
texts.en: Porfirio is married.  He lives with three grandchildren, his wife, and with the wife of one of his sons, who takes care of the children.  Porfirio sells clothing.  He has had his business for 20 years, and he works from 6am until 2pm.  He has a lot of experience since he started very young.  He needs to invest in the purchase of men's and women's pants, so he is requesting a loan in order to make the purchase.  This investment will help him improve his inventory and have more variety to meet his customers' needs.  His aspiration as a business owner is to have his own boutique, with better organization of his merchandise, in order to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase men's and women's pants.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a 48-year-old widow with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marieta has a fish vending business in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Marieta has been in this business for 24 years. Marieta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a very hardworking man. He has been married for years and they have eight children whom they constantly make efforts for. They live in the town of Tiribe.

Hamisi has been a moto taxi driver for 2 years and he has told us that his job is demanding but he likes it very much, because through this job he can support his wife and his children. He dreams of buying another taxi stand and another moto taxi to work with in order to progress a little more every day. 

He is very happy for the chance he is offered by Yehu Microfinance and by Kiva, and he is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for his moto taxi so that he will be able to keep on working and offering a good service to his customers at the same time.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is an Iraqi youth client who is 28 years old, married, and has no children.

Wissam owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents, and snacks. He established his business in 2008 and now he has an employee. He built good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Wissam is requesting a sum of $1,800 for a youth loan to install a rolling shutter and an external ceiling for his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to install a rolling shutter and an external ceiling for his shop.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a 35-year-old green grocer in Mariakani, Kenya. She is married and her husband gives additional income. Together they support three people. She has been in this business for the last five years and has done great.

This marks her fourth loan; the previous loans were paid successfully. She will use the entire loan amount to purchase more stocks of green vegetables and fruits for her grocery stall, and the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

She hopes to be successful in life.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of green vegetables and fruits for her grocery stall.

loans.name: Kushanda Kushinga Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! 

This is 43-year-old Ruramai from Masvingo. She is married and has six children, four of whom are attending school. She also cares for two dependents. 

Ruramai runs a poultry business. The business has been in operation for 2 years. She says that her challenges are some of her debtors failing to pay on time. 

Ruramai has requested a loan of $200 to buy stockfeeds and chicks. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will go towards the upkeep of her family. 

In the future, Ruramai plans to grow her business to include layers for egg production.

loans.use: to buy stockfeeds and chicks for her poultry business.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a married Iraqi client who is 30 years old and has four children. Zeinab assists her husband in providing the income of the family.

Zeinab is a tailor and works from her own house. Her mother and her elder sisters taught her how to sew. After gaining enough experience, she established her business in 2004 and specialized in tailoring women outfits. She built good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Zeinab is requesting a loan of $1,500 to buy two new sewing machines. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so that she will be able to provide her children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two new sewing machines.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is a 58-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Talibon, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and commodities to the people in her area. Brigida is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks to sell such as canned goods, rice, chips and biscuits, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and cater for more buyers in her store thus augmenting her sales and income. 
In the future, Brigida hopes to make her business successful and profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell such as canned goods, rice, chips and biscuits, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David still runs his business as a livestock trader. He has had the business for eleven years successfully. His monthly income has slightly increased and he now earns 10,000 KES. He is applying for his sixth loan from KADET LTD. He plans to purchase more goats and cows to sell. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His dream is to have a financially stable family.

loans.use: to purchase more goats and cows

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a dealer of frozen foods. She is 40 years of age, married to a policeman, with two children. The couple both work hard in order to earn a living. She has been selling frozen foods for almost eight years and earns about 30,000 PHP. She uses her income towards their daily needs, an allowance for one of her children, rental of their house and savings. 

Lorna wants to have more capital for her business due to some late payments of her customers. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP, allowing her to buy stocks of frozen foods such as tocino, embutido, longanisa (sausage) and hotdogs. She believes that her business will continue to improve so she can satisfy and supply all her customer’s needs. Lorna is looking forward to the approval of her requested loan amount so she can continue to make a profit, enabling her to sustain her family's basic needs and educate her two children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of frozen foods for her business

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is 64 years old, married with two children. She earns a living by hog raising in the Philippines. Soledad is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs. Soledad has been in the hog raising business for 31 years and also earns additional income from her general store and seafood business.

Soledad successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her hog raising business. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Nyamani

texts.en:
Nyamani sells food staples in Tiribe. He has been dedicated to this activity for more than three years. This is why he already enjoys a very good customer base that has gotten to know him very well. He is very hardworking and enterprising, with excellent referrals in his neighborhood. His goal is to grow his business into a mini-market and to keep working the same way as he has until now.
He requests this credit to purchase staple merchandise for his business such as sugar, flour and eggs. This is due to the fact that these are the products that are sold the most, therefore he wants to be able to fulfill his clientele requests.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour and eggs.

loans.name: Dzishanga

texts.en:
Dzishanga is happily married to a businesswoman. They have been blessed with three children. He is a shopkeeper and earns his living selling fish from his house, which he buys from fishermen. He would like to expand his business, and to have another shop in the outskirts of the city's wholesale market, since his products are in high demand by his customers.

Dzishanga is asking for a loan so that he can buy more fish since they are in high demand and he would like to increase his stock.

loans.use: to buy fish to re-sell.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and commodities to the people in her area. She is a married woman and has two grown-up children. Carmelita needs a loan to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, candies, rice, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract more customers in her store thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, rice, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is from Tiribe. He’s married and has four children. He and his wife work hard to be able to continue giving their children everything they need to live a life that’s free from want. Juma has owned a well-stocked cereals store in the village for more than 12 years. He stands out because the entire family works together, and they do very well. Juma’s wife brings merchandise from Mombasa to sell in their neighborhood, where they have a regular clientele. 

He’s requesting the loan to buy baked goods, vegetables, dairy products and other supplies to continue providing a good variety to the customers.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, vegetables, dairy products and other supplies.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn offers onions, garlic and fish sauce inside the public market of Santiago. She is 50 years of age and married with one child who currently goes to school. Evelyn's spouse is vendor of towels and foot sacks. The couple both work hard to generate funds for their living expenses.

Evelyn would like to take out a loan of 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos), allowing her to buy stock of garlic, onion and boxes of fish sauce for her retail stall. She hopes that her business will further improve so she can secure her family welfare and educate her only child. Evelyn believes that this additional capital she requested will help her in attaining her goals in life and her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of garlic, onion and boxes of fish sauce for her retail stall.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 58 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming bananas in the Philippines. Virginia is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her business.

Virginia has been farming bananas for 20 years and also earns additional income from firewood vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mrinzi

texts.en:
Mrinzi is married, and they have five children. This couple strives always to give their children a good education and to insure that their needs are met.

Mrinzi has been working for the last three years selling charcoal. He buys the product in the rural areas in the interior of the country and sells it broken up in various sized bags.

He requests the loan to buy larger amounts of charcoal so that he can buy it at a better price and earn higher profits to continue helping his family.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of charcoal.

loans.name: Agricultores De Paquix Iii Group

texts.es:
Es señor Augusto es casado, tiene 33 años de edad, curso 4 años de educacion primaria, tiene 4 hijos y todos estan estudiando, se dedica a la agricultura. Inicio su negocio cuando su padre le concedio una cuerda de terreno para que lo sembrara, actualmente lleva 14 años de experiencia en agricultura.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un prestamo que lo utilizara para la compra de abono que le servira para la mejor produccion se la cosecha. En el futuro quiere ver su negocio con cosecha abundante, los demas integrantes del grupo tambien se dedican a la agricultura.
texts.en:
Mr Augusto is married. is 33 years old and has finished 4 years of primary education.  He has 4 children, all in school.  He makes a living in farming.  He started his business when his father gave him a plot of land to for him to grow crops on.  He currently has 14 years of experience in farming.

He has organized a group to request a loan that will be used to buy fertilizer that will help improve the production of his fields.  In the future, he would like to see his business of farming growing.  The other members of the group are also in farming.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, ya que sus condiciones en el negocio necesitan fortalecerse, comprando materiales para decorar los eventos sociales, como fiestas, cumpleaños, bodas, por esto a través del financiamiento quiere adquirir más utensilios de resina para recuerdos, manteles, adornos, flores artificiales, copas, y otra variedad que le ayudaran para realizar un mejor trabajo. 
El efecto que tuvo Luis con el préstamo anterior, fue positivo, porque compro una variedad de materiales para decorar los eventos que los clientes le solicitan, fue exitoso y quiere darle más vida al negocio. En su familia el núcleo se mantiene, en su condición económica considera estar mejor ya que ha tenido muchos contratos que realizar.
texts.en:
Luis decided to request a new loan because his business needs to be reinforced.  He needs to buy material for decorating social events such as parties, birthdays, weddings.  With this loan he wants to get more plastic utensils, table cloths, decorations, artificial flowers, glasses and others to help him to do better work.

The results from the last loan that Luis received were positive, he bought a variety of products to decorate the events that his customers hire him for.  He was successful and now wants to give his business more life.  His family unit is stable.  He believes that his financial position is better since he has had many contracts to fulfill.

loans.use: to purchase table cloths,, decorations, artificial flowers, glasses.

loans.name: Aisha's Group

texts.en:
Aisha, who is in her early 30s, is married and a mother of three girls who are in school. For a period of six years now, Aisha has had a mamalishe (restaurant) offering different food services. She wishes to start another business selling sarongs door to door. She works from 06am to 03pm daily and is able to make a small profit each month.

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy ingredients for her mamalishe menu items like sacks of rice, beans, kilos of sugar, baking flour, maize flour and repair her mamalishe place. With the profits she bought a plot of land for building a house in the future. With this loan request, she will use it to increase her food stocks and start selling sarongs door to door to increase her profits. Her dream is to one day be able to build a house.

She will share this loan with her loan group " MWANGALUKA " which totals 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her food stocks at her restaurant and start selling sarongs door to door.

loans.name: Munga

texts.en:
Munga is very pleased with everything he has accomplished. He was able to build a commercial space at the front of his house from profits earned, where he set up a store that is well-stocked with fruits and vegetables, and he says that he has a very good customer base.
He is requesting a loan to buy consumer staples so that he can stock his store with good products. He wants to buy drinks, bread, fruits, vegetables and other products.

loans.use: to buy drinks, bread, fruits, vegetables and other products.

loans.name: Edito

texts.en:
Edito is 47 years old and lives in Annafatan with his wife and nine children. Seven of whom are studying while the other two are too young to attend school. Edito is a farmer growing rice and corn to sell. He had been in the business over 10 years now and he still aims for the improvement of his production because cost of living now is expensive especially as he educates his children.

He is now asking for a loan of P 15,000 to buy crude oil, fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. This will help maintain healthy crops to harvest.

Edito is hoping for an abundant harvest to invest in a hog raising business. He hopes to educate all his children.

loans.use: to buy crude oil, fertilizers and insecticides to use on his rice and corn crops.

loans.name: Aleja

texts.en:
Aleja is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells recyclable materials in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy more recyclable materials like plastic bottles, glass bottles, etc. to sell.
Aleja has been in this business for 25 years. Aleja earns additional income from buying and selling rice.
Aleja has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more recyclable materials like plastic bottles, glass bottles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is 35 years old, married and has two young children. Dennis is a farmer and his wife works abroad. Though apart, the couple works hard to generate income to sustain the needs of the family. Dennis plants and harvests rice to sell. He also pays laborers to help him on the farm.

Dennis’ crops needs maintenance and that is why he is now asking for a loan of P 15,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. It will help nourish the crops and someday harvest it profitably. Additional revenue will be used in the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use on his rice crops.

loans.name: Catalino

texts.en:
Catalino is 49 years old, married and has four children. He derives income from planting and harvesting rice to sell to traders. He also grows corn and vegetables such as eggplant and string beans to sell. From selling the raised crops, he earns about P 10,000. It goes for meals, allowance and bills at home.
He is now asking for a loan of P 15,000 to buy insecticides and fertilizers used in farming.
Someday, with good crops he will attain abundant harvests for the development of his income and give a better way of living to his family.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and fertilizers to use on his crops.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
A farmer from Amulung named Reynaldo has patiently managed his business for over 10 years now. Reynaldo is 51 years old, married and has a child who is in elementary school. His wife is his partner in planting and harvesting rice to sell. They usually gain PHP 10,000 each harvest season, which is two times a year.

Reynaldo is now asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming. He hopes to raise healthy crops and acquire more profits. The additional revenue generated will be used in improving his crop production and for the education of his child.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use for his crops.

loans.name: Muache

texts.en: Muache has operated a grocery business for years. Muache is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with fruits, vegetables, onions, soft drinks and other merchandise that she will then resell.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables, onions, soft drinks and other merchandise for her grocery stall.

loans.name: Freddinah

texts.en:
Freddinah is a 44-year-old baker in Shanzu, Mombasa. She is married and her husband earns additional income, and together they support one child. She has been in this business for the last five years and has done great.

This marks her second loan from KADET LTD the previous loan was repaid successfully and she will purchase wheat flour, margarine, milk and other cake ingredients for her baking and use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her child.
She hopes to own a full bakery in future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, margarine, milk and other cake ingredients for her baking.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is 45 years old and married with four children.

Angeline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks like coffee, sugar, vinegar, canned goods and other groceries to sell.

Angeline has borrowed and paid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Angeline aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks like coffee, sugar, vinegar, canned goods and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various beauty products.

loans.name: Mildred Pamela

texts.es:
La Sra. Mildred vive en Guayaquil, tiene 32 años .Ella empezó su tienda hace 7 años con un préstamo familiar decidió establecer un pequeño negocio, poco a poco fue incrementando sus ventas hasta llegar a tener una mini tienda.

La Sra. empieza desde las 6 de la mañana todos los dias y despues va a dejar a sus hijos a la escuela y abre su negocio.

Con la ayuda de Dios va progresando en su negocio día a día , no es casada , pero es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos que estudian en escuela fiscal.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar arroz, azucar, enlatados y vivieres de primera necesidad. Sus sueños es que todos sus hijos culminen la universidad y sean profesionales, de esta forma todo el esfuerzo que realiza día a día no será en vano
texts.en:
Sra. Mildred, age 32, lives in Guayaquil. She opened her store seven years ago with a loan from a relative because she wanted to establish her own business. Her sales gradually increased and now she has a mini-market.

Sra. Mildred begins her work every day at 6:00 A.M. She opens her business after she takes her children to school. With the help of God, she continues to make progress in her business day after day. Mildred is not married, but she is a single mother of three children who attend a state school.

With this loan, she will buy rice, sugar, canned goods, and basic staples. Her dream is to see all of her children finish university and become professionals so that all of her daily efforts do not go to waste.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, canned goods, and basic staples.

loans.name: Fany Cecilia

texts.es:
Fany,tiene un negocio de venta de ropa, recargas de saldo a celulares y una pequeña tienda. Ella tiene 27 años de edad y es  madre soltera, vive con su hija y su mama.La tienda la posee desde hace 5 años y trabaja con su mama, quien le esta enseñando a administrarlo.
El crédito lo invertirá en compra de ropa, artículos para la tienda y compra de recargas, Esta inversión le permitirá incrementar su inventario y obtener más ingresos.
Su objetivo es fortalecer el negocio y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Fany has a business selling clothes, mobile phone top-ups and a small shop. She is 27 years old and is a single mother.  Fany lives with her daughter and mother.  She has now had the shop for five years and she works with her mother, who is teaching her how to manage it.

Fany will invest the loan in buying clothes, items for the shop and to buy phone top-ups. This investment will allow her to increase her stock and earn a higher income.

Her aim is to strengthen the business and provide a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes, items for the shop and to buy top-ups.

loans.name: Marvin Gabriel

texts.es:
Marvín, solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertir en el cultivo de granos básicos de la temporada, ya que  se dedica a la agricultura; Le permitirá comprar abono orgánico y herbicidas, para cultivar el maíz.  
Con el crédito anterior aumento la productividad y sus ingresos los invirtió en el consumo del hogar, también este crédito de Kiva le ayudo a mejorar las condiciones de vida y económicas.
texts.en:
Marvín works in agriculture and is applying for a new loan to invest in growing basic, seasonal grains.  The loan will allow him to buy organic fertiliser and herbicides to grow corn.

With his previous loan, Marvín was able to increase productivity and his income, which he invested in the household.  This loan will also help Marvín to improve his living conditions and financial situation.

loans.use: to buy organic fertiliser and herbicides.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es:
José, tiene una granja de pollos de engorde para obtener ingresos y así ayudar en los gastos del hogar. Su edad es de 23 años, está acompañado y tiene un hijo de 1 año de edad, vive en casa de sus padres. 
El tiene un año de tener su negocio y lo aprendió porque trabajo en una avícola campestre; El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de pollos, alimentos(concentrado) para engordar los pollos y vitaminas para ellos.
Le ayudara en el recurso financiero porque podrá invertir en el negocio y aumentará  la producción, así obtener mejores entradas de dinero.
texts.en:
José has a farm for fattening chickens so that he can make a living and help with household costs.  He is 23 years old and has a partner and a one year old son.  He lives with his parents.  

José has had the business for a year, having learned the trade in a rural poultry farm.  He will invest this loan in buying chickens and chicken feed to fatten the birds, and vitamins.

The loan will be a financial help to José as he will be able to invest it in the business and increase production and thus improve his income level.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 33-years-old from Naivasha and is married to Mwangi. They have four children who are in school.

Elizabeth has been distributing cakes and chips for the past four years. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy oven and potatoes. She hopes to expand her business and open several branches in the near future.

loans.use: To buy an oven and potatoes for making chips.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is now 35 years old; he is still operating a motorcycle transport business and has been doing this for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 15,000 which he uses to support his family. He also owns a rickshaw which supplements his income. He is still repaying his previous loan. 

He will use the loan to purchase a new motorcycle. With the anticipated profits from the business, he will educate his child. 

His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable and be able to cater for his family’s needs with ease.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Nury Adely

texts.es: Nury de 26 años, se dedica al cultivo de cereales, los cuales almacena para vender y para el consumo de su grupo familiar (como muestra la fotografia, en la que posa junto al silo en el que lo almacena mientras el precio se incrementa para venderlos a mejor precio y para usarlo segun la demanda interna para elaboracion de sus alimentos). Su grupo familiar es de 8 personas (18, 16, 14, 11, 10, 9, 7, 3 años) quienes dependen al 100% de la actividad agricola, en el que toda la familia participa recolectando los cultivos de maiz, frijol. El credito lo requiere para adquirir fertilizantes y plaguicidas para llevar a feliz termino los cultivos y obtener buena cosecha
texts.en:
Nury is 26 years old. She earns a living cultivating grains which she stores in order to sell. The grains are also consumed by her family members. The photo shows her posing beside the silo where she stores the grains until prices rise to sell at the best price, as well as to use for internal consumption. 

Her family has eight members (aged 18, 16, 14, 11, 10, 9, 7, and 3) who fully depend on her agricultural work. The entire family participates in the work, harvesting the corn and beans. 

The loan is required to buy fertilizers and insecticides to bring her crops to maturation and to obtain a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 35 years old. She is from Ndunyu Njeru and is married to Samuel; they have five children.

Elizabeth is a farmer and has applied for her first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable her to buy farm inputs e.g fertilizer, insecticides and seedlings.

She hopes to be among the top farmers in her area in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, insecticides  and seedlings.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is from Kaloleni. She is married and has been the owner of a beauty salon for more than five years. Pili also operates a farming business which provides her with another source of income.

She is a hardworking and enterprising person who has the vision to move forward. Through her daily efforts, she has been able to accomplish this. Her goal is to continue growing and helping her relatives.

Pili is requesting this loan so that she can buy supplies for her beauty salon such as dyes, creams, gels, shampoo, rinses, and other items. This will allow her to provide her customers with excellent and high-quality service.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon such as dyes, creams, gels, shampoo, rinses, and other items.

loans.name: Edisa

texts.en:
Edisa is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Talibon, Bohol. Edisa has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 24 years now. 

Edisa is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, floaters and others. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus allowing them to have more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, floaters and others.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 47-year-old retail proprietor who makes home detergent in Voi,Kenya. She is a single mother who supports two children. She has been in this business for the last three years and has done great.

This marks her third loan from KADET LTD, after paying back the previous ones successfully. She will purchase ingredients to make home detergents like liquid soap for utensils and general house cleaning detergent, and the anticipated profit will be used to provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes to succeed in her business and have a successful life.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make home detergents.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Michael. He is married, and has two children aged six and three; both are school-going children. He has three additional dependents, who live with him to be fostered. 

In 2007, Michael established his assorted timber (boards) business. He began his business because the civil war in Sierra Leone made him unable to further his education. After the war, he decided to learn carpentry. He worked with his boss for some years and the money he got was used to open a small workshop. The workshop has now grown into a bigger one with some modern machines.  

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,150,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Michael requires a loan in order to buy assorted timber and leather cloth. 

In the future, Michael plans to educate his children, build a house and buy a delivery van. The loan will help to generate more income. Lack of delivery van and the fact that some customers will not pay on time are his major challenges. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy assorted timber and leather cloth.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 36-year-old married man, a father of one child. He has been working in house painting for thirteen years. Fadi is a Palestinian refugee living in a Palestinian Camp. Because he is skilled in his business, and highly talented since he puts so much effort into knowing all the new methods in painting and construction in addition to decoration, he has customers from outside the Camp who recommend him to others which increases his income. 

Fadi is applying for his fourth loan cycle from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a special machine used for decoration work and to renew his business tools. This is done in order to keep his business ready for any request from customers.

Fadi loves his business a lot, and works hard to keep updating it because this is the only way he can please his customers and develop his social and financial living standards.

He hopes to keep on expanding his business as much as he can to ensure his family have a good and peaceful life.

loans.use: to buy a special machine used for decoration work and to renew his business tools.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a meat supplier in Tala town and she also has a butchery business. She supplies meat to various butcheries as well as hotels. She has been in this business for six years now and it has been profitable. She is 37-years-old and a single mother to one school-going child.

This being her first loan term, she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of meat to sell and supply to her customers. She anticipates to make more profits that she will use to pay the school fees for her child.

She hopes to expand her business by supplying meat to all the hotels and butchery shops in the region.

loans.use: To buy more meat to sell and supply.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She and her husband are engaged in a carpentry and furniture business and have been in these ventures for more than five years now. This is the source of their income.

Constancia is asking for a loan to buy materials for carpentry like wood, nails and others. In the future, Constancia hopes to expand their business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy materials for carpentry like wood, nails and others.

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.en:
Cornelio is 58-year-old fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in the fishing business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of his income.

Cornelio is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, hooks, floaters and others. Cornelio hopes to make his fishing business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, hooks, floaters and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase drinking rubber buckets, hot pot dishes, serving trays, tea cups, table spoons, kitchen knives and jugs.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 46-years-old, and is a water vendor in Tudor, Mombasa. She is married and her husband provides additional income, together they support two people. 

This marks her second loan from KADET LTD; the previous loan was paid successfully. She will purchase big water tanks to hold more liters of water to sell. She plans to reinvest into her business with her anticipated profits. She hopes to own several business of the same kind.

loans.use: to purchase big water tanks to hold more liters of water to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Marina

texts.es: Doña Blanca, de 37 años, vive en Canton LLano Grande, ubicado en Concepcion Quezaltepeque del Departamento de Chalatenango, ubicado al norte del pais. Ella inicio la actividad de fabricacion de hamacas hace 10 años, es casada y solo estudiò hasta 7mo grado, tiene 3 hijos, pero solo 2 dependen de ella (14 y 13 años). Ella solicita el credito para compra de madera, que le sirve de soporte para colocar los hilos y tejer las hamacas (que se muestra en la fotografia, como se elaboran, colocando hilos en tablas de madera de forma vertical a las que se van entretejiendo hebras hasta formar las hamacas, que forman parte de la cultura salvadoreña (artesania) y sirven para descansar en ambientes calurosos, usandola desde bebes hasta adultos, y principalmente en zonas rurales en las que muchas personas no cuentan con una cama para dormir
texts.en:
37-year-old Blanca lives in Llano Grande canton, in Concepción Quezaltepeque, in Chalatenango department, in the north of the country.  She started her hammock-making business 10 years ago.   Blanca is married and only studied up to her seventh year at school.  She has three children but only two are still dependent on her (14 and 13 years).

Blanca is requesting this loan to buy wood on which she will support her threads and weave her hammocks which can be seen in the photograph.  She places her threads across wooden planks and then makes her hammocks by weaving among them.  Hammocks are a part of Salvadoran culture (handicrafts) and are used for resting in hot weather.  Everybody uses them, from babies to adults.  They are mainly used in rural areas where many people don't have a bed to sleep in.

loans.use: to buy materials for making hammocks

loans.name: Lelian

texts.en:
Lelian is a 36-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. Lelian has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 16 years now. This is the source of their income. 

Lelian is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. With them, her husband will be able to enhance his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Lelian dreams of expanding their business and making it sustainable. Moreover, she wants to save money to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items.

loans.name: Hector Napoleon

texts.es: Hector Napoleon de 62 años, se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de electrodomesticos usados, que compra y repara para volver a utilizar, y asi evitar que se tiren a la basura e incrementar la contaminacion, y ademas provee de electrodomesticos a bajo costo a personas de bajos ingresos que no tienen capacidad de adquirirlos nuevos. Su grupo familiar esta compuesto por su esposa y un hijo
texts.en:
Hector Napoleon, 62 years old, has been working for 10 years selling used appliances, which he buys and repairs so that they can be used again. This avoids having them be thrown out and increasing pollution. In addition, it provides low-cost appliances to low-income people who don't have the ability to get them new.

His family is made up of his spouse and one child.

loans.use: to buy used appliances for resale.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie lives in Sinkor in Montserrado County near the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 46 years old, married with three children between the ages of 19 and 24. They are all at school and live at home with their parent. 

For ten years now, Annie has been running a table market in the local market where she sells fresh and dry fish, rice, and oil. She started this business from her susu (local saving account) and learned this way of selling from her mother. She likes her business because it gives her profits and makes her popular. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more dry and fresh fish, rice, and oil for her business. She wants to get more money to build her children a house.

loans.use: to buy more dry and fresh fish, rice, and oil for her business.

loans.name: Munduli B Group

texts.en:
Tano, who is in her early 30s, is single with one child who goes to school. She has been running a Gengeduka (a shop which sells fruit, vegetables, dry food like sugar wheat flour, baking flour, beans etc). She has been in this business for five years now.  She works from 6.00 am to 8.00 pm daily and is able to make a small profit.

This will be Tano's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start selling sarongs, bought missing items for the Gengeduka and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the interest to pay school fees and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more fruit, vegetables, sugar, beans, salt, flour and groundnuts. She dreams of building  her own house.

Tano will share this loan with her loan group "MUNDULI B" which has ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruit, vegetables, sugar, beans, salt, flour and groundnuts.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: Doña Maria de 44 años de edad vive con su esposo y un hijo en casa propia, tiene una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad, esta ubicada en su lugar de residencia, Doña Maria esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar mas productos y surtir su tienda para ofrecerles mas articulos a sus clientes y poder tener mas ganacias que le ayuden a cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en: Maria, 44, lives with her husband and one son in their own house. She owns a store were she sells basic goods which is found in her home. Maria is seeking a loan to buy more products and to stock the store in order to offer more products to her customers and be able to have larger profits to help her cover household expenditure.

loans.use: to have working capital.

loans.name: Eugene's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of two partners residing in Dansoman. They are Eugene and Gladstone. They have been together from April 2010 and are still doing very well. They respectively sell second-hand home appliances (TV, DVD player, sound systems, microwave, blender etc) and lubricants.

Eugene, the leader, is 33 years old. He has been doing this for the past five years. On the 25th March, 2010, he took his first loan of GHS 200. Through his dedication and seriousness in his business, he has been able to build up trust with ID Ghana. 

For his seventh loan, he is requesting an amount of GHS 3,000 to help him boost the business and to satisfy his customers' demand in and around the community.

The two members together need GHS 4,500 to buy more goods and sell to their respective customers in the community.

loans.use: to buy more sound systems, microwaves, and blenders for his customers.

loans.name: Yenni Esmeralda

texts.es: Yenni de 25 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas que son menores de edad, tiene un tienda en su lugar de residencia donde vende artículos de primera necesidad frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros y con eso ha podido ayudar en los gasto de su hogar, ella solicita un credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y surtir la tienda y poder resivir mas ganancias para seguir ayudando en su hogar.
texts.en:
Yenni, 25, lives with her husband and two underage daughters. She has a grocery store at home, where she sells essential supplies, such as beans, milk, eggs and bread. With this activity, she has been able to help supporting her family.

Yenni is requesting a loan to buy more supplies and stock her store. This will result in better profits and the possibility to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her grocery store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 26-year-old business lady. She is a married mother of two children. She sells fish to the residents of Thika town. She also operates a motorcycle transport business to supplement her income. She has done her fish-selling business for the past three years with great success. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd. to finance her businesses. She plans to purchase more fish i.e. sardines and tilapia.

She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish such as sardines and tilapia.

loans.name: Melva Antonia

texts.es:
Melva es una mujer de 51 años de edad que a pesar de su edad no deja de soñar en grande y de cumplir cada una de sus  metas propuestas. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria no completa cursado hasta el 3 grado y junto a su esposos se han dedicado a la agricultura por mas de 15 años. De su matrimonio tiene 3 hijos los cuales en familia se dedican al cultivo y siembra de café todos son menores de edad y viven bajo el mismo techo y depende de ella. Sus padres quienes dedicados desde toda una vida a esta actividad le enseñaron desde muy joven la agricultura ya que por la falta de recursos económicos no pudieron seguirla apoyando en sus estudios. Su producto es comercializado y vendido en los alrededores de la zona donde ella habita con algunos familiares, amigos y demás que la caracterizan por ser una mujer honesta, responsable y dedicada.

Actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de abonos, Fungicidas, Insecticidas y bombas de riego para su cultivo de café ya que por medio de estos productos ella evitara que sus cultivos sean infectados por plagas y la enfermedad de la roya misma que destroza toda una producción de ser contaminada.

Sus sueños son de poder educar a sus 3 hijos a nivel universitario para que ellos puedan ser hombres y mujeres emprendedores capaces de formar sus propios negocios, sus propias empresas y puedan generar empleo para el desarrollo y beneficio de nuestro país ya que el trabajo de la agricultura es pesado y las ganancias son pocas.
texts.en:
Melva is a 51-year-old woman who, in spite of her age, doesn't stop dreaming big and fulfilling every one of the goals she sets herself.  She didn't complete her primary education, only studying up to 3rd grade.  She and her husband have been farming for more than 15 years.  They have three children who help farm and sow coffee.  The children are all under 18, live under the same roof as their parents and are dependent on their mother.  Melva's parents, who spent their whole lives in this business, taught her how to farm at a very young age because, for financial reasons, they were unable to continue supporting her education.  Melva's produce is sold in the surrounding area to family members, friends and other people, who describe her as an honest, responsible, committed woman. 

Melva is currently requesting help in buying fertilizers, fungicides, insecticides and irrigation pumps for her coffee crops.  These products will allow her to prevent her crops becoming infested with pests or suffering from rust, a disease which can destroy a whole crop.

Melva's dreams are to be able to educate her three children to university level so that they can become entrepreneurial men and women who are able to set up their own businesses and companies and generate employment for the development and benefit of the country.  She wants this for them as farm work is hard and its profits are small.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, fungicides, insecticides and irrigation pumps for her coffee crops

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
She owns a small, well-stocked cafe where she works very hard every day. 

Amina is requesting the loan to buy milk, bread, meats, beverages and other products needed to stock the cafe so it can continue growing and providing customers with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy a stock of merchandise for her cafe.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn has been engaged in aluminum fabrication and glass installation with her husband for more than six years now. She is a married woman and has four children.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy additional materials like aluminum, steel, glass and others. With this, they will be able to cater for additional requests from their customers who are improving their houses.

In the future, Jocelyn hopes to make their business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like aluminum, steel and glass.

loans.name: Maria Eva

texts.es: Doña Maria de 53 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos es muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora tiene una tienda en su lugar de residencia la cual le va muy bien en sus ventas, solicita un credito para poder comprar mas productos para su tienda en especial frijoles y gas propano ya que con eso ayuda en los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Maria, 53 years old, lives with her spouse and their two children. She is very responsible, honest and hardworking. She has a shop in her home, which is going very well for her in terms of sales.

She is asking for a loan to be able to buy more products for her shop, especially beans and propane gas, since with these she helps to pay her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy products for her shop.

loans.name: Gloria Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Gloria de 62 años vive con su mamá en la casa de su nieto, tiene una tienda en su lugar de residencia la cual le ha generado buenos ingresos para ir solventando las necesidaes de su hogar, solicta un credito para poder invertir mas en su tienda porque necesita comprar mas productos de primera necesidad y comprar mas bebeidas porque es lo que mas vende en su zona.
texts.en: Gloria, 62, lives with her mother in her grandson's home, she owns a store located in her residence and which which she has generated a healthy income to cover the household needs. She is seeking a loan to invest more in her store because she needs to buy basic goods and more drinks because these are the products that sell the most in her area.

loans.use: to have working capital.

loans.name: Marri Group

texts.en:
Marriama and Juliana are the members of this group. They sell provisions and cooked rice respectively. They have been together since 2011.  

Marriama is a 40-year-old provision-seller (milo, sugar, rice, milk etc.) who is married to Abdallah, a 47 year old business man. She has been with ID Ghana for the past two years and is doing very well with her business. 

She has been doing this business for three years now. She works from Mondays through to Saturdays. Without ID Ghana’s training on savings she would not have made it this far. 

This is her 4th loan and she needs GHS 1,100 to buy more to sell to her customers. 

Both need a total amount of GHS 1,550 to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: to buy more milo, sugar, milk and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Segundo Antonio

texts.es: Don Antonio de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a su familia Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos es muy trabajador, se dedica a ser agricultor. Antonio desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: 45-year-old Antonio lives in his own home. He is a responsible man with his home obligations, since he has always been known for providing the best to his family. Currently, he lives together with his wife and his children. He is a hard worker and is a farmer. Antonio wants to increase his sales, which is why he is requesting a loan that will allow him to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers and pesticides among other inputs. He desires to be able to have this loan, given that he does not have other monetary income, and in this way he will continue bringing the daily bread to his home without limitation.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Juana Maximina

texts.es: Doña Juana de 49 años vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos tiene una tienda con la cual solventa todo tipo de gastos que tiene en su hogar, ella solicita un credito para construir una pared en un cuarto ya que con las ganancias de la tienda no le alcanza para solvertar ese gasto.
texts.en:
Doña Juana, 49, lives with her husband and children in their own house. She runs a grocery store, an activity that helps her cover her home expenses.

Doña Juana is requesting a loan to build a wall in a room, since the profits from the store are not enough to cover this expense.

loans.use: to build a wall in a room.

loans.name: Atta's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of two members, Atta and Vida. They are a seamstress and hairdresser in the community, respectively. They reside in the Dansoman community. They have been together from 2012 to date and are still doing very well.

Atta is a 27-year-old seamstress. She has been with ID Ghana for the past one year and is doing very well. She has been in this business activity for 3 years now. She sells from Mondays to Saturdays. 

This is her 3rd loan and she needed an amount of 1,000 GHS to buy more to sell to her customers. She has been able, through her business, to provide herself with a quality education. She is grateful to ID Ghana. 

Atta and Vida need a total amount of 2,000 GHS to buy more to sell to their customers in the Dansoman community.

loans.use: to buy more materials to sew and sell to their customers

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. They live in Talibon, Bohol. Janeth has been engaged in manicure and pedicure services for more than 15 years now. This is the source of her income.

Janeth is asking for a loan to buy additional materials for manicure and pedicure like nail polish, a cutter and nail polish remover. With this, she will be able to cater for more customers and clients thus augmenting her earnings and income.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for manicure and pedicure like nail polish, a cutter and nail polish remover.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.en: Saturnino is a 59-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol.  He is a fisherman and has been in the fishing business for more than 10 years now.  Saturnino is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, floaters, and other items.  Saturnino hopes that this loan could help him improve his business.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and floaters.

loans.name: Eline

texts.en:
Eline lives at Sinkor in Montserrado County near the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 40 years old and married with six children between the ages of 9 months and 20 years old. Only five of them are in school and they all live at home.

For ten years now she has been running a table market where she sells rice, peanuts, beans, pepper, and others items. She started this business with the help of her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She likes her business because it gives her more money and meeting her own expenses makes her proud of her business.

She is requesting a loan to buy more rice, peanuts, beans, pepper and others items to expand her business.  She wishes to buy a piece of land and build her house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, peanuts, beans, pepper and others items to expand her business

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of two members, Esther and Monica.  They sell pastries and porridge (koko) in the community called Russia, within the Dansoman neighborhood.  They have been a group since 2011.

Esther is a 24-year-old pastry seller who has been selling for the past 7 years.  She works Monday through Saturday from her home or hawks to her customer.  With this 1,500 GHS, her 4th loan, she plans to buy flour, sugar, and margarine.  This will help her prepare pastries to sell to her customers. 

They need a total amount of GHS 2,200 to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, and margarine for pastries.

loans.name: Maria Evangelina

texts.es: Maria Evangelina, se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosmeticos y exhibe su mercaderia como lo muestra la fotografia, tal como se acostumbra en mercados informarles (sobre la acera o banqueta) y los fines de semana lo hace de forma ambulante, en cantones y caserios cercanos. Ella vive con sus 3 hijos (23, 15, y 12 años) a quienes mantiene directamente. La mercaderia que ella comercializa, es ropa interior para damas y caballeros, lociones, calzado de bajo costo. Ella solicita su credito para comprar fardo de ropa usada y obtener mas ganancias, ya que hay un sector de poblacion que debido a la crisis economica no puede adquirir ropa nueva, por lo que compra ropa usada que se recibe de USA, que està en buen estado y es de bajo valor. Ella obtiene un margen de ganancia promedio del 32%, por lo que con la inversion solicitada de $400 obtendra $128 que reinvertira en comprar mas mercaderia y cosmeticos, para dejar al credito a algunas personas que le han solicitado plazo para adquirir la mercaderia
texts.en:
Maria Evangelina sells clothes and cosmetics and displays her goods on the side of the street or on a bench as is usual for informal markets, as shown in the photograph. At the weekend, she is a mobile seller in nearby towns and areas. 

She lives with the 3 children (aged 23, 15 and 12) who she directly supports. The goods that she sells are underwear for both ladies and gentlemen, lotions, and cheap shoes. 

She is requesting the loan to buy bundles of used clothing to make more profits as there is a sector of the population who due to the economic crisis can´t buy new clothing. For this reason, she buys used clothing which comes from the USA which is good quality and low cost. 

She earns a profit margin of 32% so with the requested investment of $400, she will get $128 that she can reinvest to buy more goods and cosmetics and acquire the merchandise that some of her customers have requested.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell

loans.name: Tatiana Beatriz

texts.es: Tatiana de 31 años de edad vive con su mama y su hijo en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia en una localidad, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: 31-year-old Tatiana lives with her mother and child in their own home. She has a store where she sells basic necessities, beans, milk, eggs, bread etc. She has been in this business for many years, which has given her sales experience that allows her to obtain the best profit. Her business is in her home in a locality. She is well-known amongst the neighbors and has built a large client base, since she has the store stocked. She wants to increase her business and make a new investment, but she needs capital. This is why she is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy what is necessary for her store. She assures that she will pay the debt and at the same time confides that it will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: have working capital to stock her store.

loans.name: Jose Alonso

texts.es: Don Jose, a sus 66 años, se dedica a la barberia que tiene ubicada en una zona de alto transito en san salvador. Dada su experiencia de 22 años en esta actividad, goza de preferencia de sus clientes y con los ingresos que ha obtenido, ha logrado educar a sus hijos hasta el bachillerato para poder luego financierles la universidad (es parte de su sueño) . KIVA le financio hace un tiempo atras, la adquisicion de utensilios para atender su negocio: maquinas de aceitar, navajas, tijera, sillas. Por ahora el desea surtir de otros productos, para modernizar un poco su sala de ventas y lograr proveer un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
At 66 years old, Jose works as a barber in a high-traffic zone of San Salvador. Given his 22 years of experience in this profession, he has loyal customers. With the income he has earned, he has been able to educate his children up to high school, so that he can later pay for them to go to university (this is part of his dream). 

Kiva gave him a loan some time ago to buy new tools such as electric shavers, shaving knives, scissors, and barber's chairs. For now, he wants to acquire other products, to modernize his sales room and be able to provide better service.

loans.use: to acquire products to modernize his sales room.

loans.name: Cruz Estela

texts.es: Cruz Estela, de 41 años, vive con su esposo y 2 hijos (21 y 15 años), se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa para ambos sexos (ropa interior para damas y caballeros, faldas, camisas), tiene 9 años de experiencia en la actividad y lo hace de forma ambulante en los caserios vecinos a su ubicacion . Solicita financiento para adquirir un bloque de prendas a bajo precio, y revenderlas
texts.en: Cruz Estela, 41, lives with her husband and 2 children (aged 15 and 21), he makes his living buying and selling clothes for both men and women (underwear for men and women, skirts and shirts). She has nine years of experience in this field and sells from door-to-door in the villages near to her location. Cruz Estela is seeking financing to obtain a large volume of clothes at a low price and sell them on.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of three children from Talibon, Bohol. Rosela has been engaged in a hog-raising business for more than 3 years now.

Rosela is asking for a loan to buy feeds for the pigs. With this, she will be able to grow healthy pigs in her piggery.  Rosela hopes of making her business grow and productive.

loans.use: to buy feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina lives in Sinkor in Montserrado County near the capital city of Liberia. It is well known as the commercial city of Liberia. She is 40 years old and married with five children between 9 and 21 who are in school.

For five years she has been selling rice, pepper, bitter ball, Vita, palm oil and others items. She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her.  She likes her business because it gives her more profits and makes her popular.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, bitter ball, Vita, palm oil and other items for her business. She wants to get more money to build her house and buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, bitter ball, Vita, palm oil and others items for her business

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
Sergia is a 58-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children from Talibon, Bohol.  She, together with her husband, is engaged in the rice farming business for 30 years now.

Sergia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.  With this, they will be able to improve their farming business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Soveida Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña Soveida de 46 años de edad es divorciada vive sola en casa propia, tiene una tienda de la cual puede solventar algunos de sus gastos, solicita un credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia para su tienda y poder generar mas ganacias que le ayudaran para sus gastos.
texts.en:
Soveida is 46 years old. She is divorced and lives alone in her own house.

She has a shop with which she can pay off some of her bills. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy stock for her shop and generate more profits which will help her with all her bills.

loans.use: to buy stock for her shop

loans.name: P At Group

texts.en:
The P At Group is made up of 3 members who have been accessing loans from ID-Ghana since 2009.  Their names are Patience, Matilda, and Juliet.  They sell provisions, tomatoes, and fresh fish.  ID Ghana has been of great service to them since they have been able to grow their small businesses through credit.  

Patience is 37 years old and sells provisions, such as rice, sugar, soap, canned tomatoes, and sardines.  She is married to Michael, who is a 39-year-old electrician.  She has 7 years’ experience in her business and works 6 days a week (from Monday to Saturday).  She is constantly working to improve her business capital. 

This is her 6th loan with ID-Ghana.  She is requesting the amount of GHS 1,200 to buy more provisions to sell to her customers in the community.  The group needs a total amount of GHS 2,050 for business expansion and to meet customers’ demands.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, soap, and sardines.

loans.name: Teodola

texts.en: Teodola earns a living through selling various goods and commodities in her retail business.  Teodola is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks to sell, such as clothing and household materials (i.e. brushes, kitchenware, etc.).  With this, she will be able to augment her income by selling and catering to more people.

loans.use: to buy clothing and household materials to sell.

loans.name: Tujikwamue Group

texts.en:
Hamisi, 40, is a married man with a school-aged daughter. Since 2006, Hamisi has been running a fish-selling business. He starts his activities at 10am and works until 9pm every day. He is able to make a good profit each month. 

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan, which he paid back successfully, to purchase additional fish to resell. With the profit he made, he covered home expenses and school fees for his girl. He will use this loan to renovate his business premises and start a broiler business. He dreams of being a big fish-selling man and owning his own fishing boats. 

He will share this loan with his loan group, Tujikwamue, which totals 12 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying the loan back.

loans.use: to renovate his fish-selling business premises and start a broiler business.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 51 years old and sells rice in Tala town.  She is married to a businessman named James.  Besides the rice business, she also rears poultry which she later sells to various hotels in Tala town.  

With this, her first loan term, she plans to buy more rice to sell.  She also plans to buy more chicken broilers for her poultry business.  She will use the generated income to buy more stocks of rice to boost her business.

Regina hopes to open a wholesale shop and buy a vehicle in order to supply rice to other areas of the Tala region.  This will help her to increase her income and better provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 19-year-old single man, who has been working in selling and maintaining household electrical appliances since four years ago. This is a wide domain to work with, especially since his business is located in a very good business region. His business is well known since it was opened in 1997 by his father before he got it and developed it for his own, so the customers know them a lot and that's a positive point forward. 

Mohamad is applying for his first YOUTH loan cycle from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy refrigerators and power generators, which he needs a lot in his business because he is skilled in maintenance upon customers needs and requests. Mohamad is planning to expand the customer service and maintenance departments to develop his business better and expand his working skills. He has to invest in improving his work forward.

loans.use: To buy refrigerators and power generators

loans.name: Intisar

texts.en:
Intisar is a 44-year-old divorced woman who has been working as a butcher since June 2012. Intisar used to work in a butchery, but today she has her own shop and two employees to help her in her business. Intisar is a hard working woman who insists on proving that no matter what is the business to be taken, a woman can do it perfectly. It is unique to see a woman who works as a butcher in Lebanon. Maybe she is the first one too, but Intisar is proud of herself and she is sure that she can succeed.

She is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase her business capital through increasing the quantity of meat she sells at her shop to increase her income. At the beginning, Intisar couldn't save anything from her business because she had a start up business loan and a lot of unexpected expenses. Today she is stronger and well known better than before, and is insisting on expanding her business more and more to reply better to the increasing customer needs.

loans.use: To increase her business capital through increasing the quantity of meat she sells at her shop

loans.name: Carren

texts.en:
Carren is a 28-year-old, humble lady and a mother of three children aged 5, 7 and 19 years, respectively. She buys cereals from farmers and sells it to retailers and wholesalers in Bomet town. Carren has been in the business for the last four years, earning a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

She learned about KADET from a credit officer who was marketing in her area of operation. She has been advanced a first loan of 10,000 KES which will enable her to purchase more stock cereals for sale e.g. dry maize, beans and peas.

She hopes to use the anticipated profits to employ a worker so as to sufficiently serve her clients. Her hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of cereals to sell e.g. dry maize, beans and peas.

loans.name: Sakua Group

texts.en:
Sakua group consists of 3 partners all from Glefe in Dansoman. They are Juliana, Eunice and Sakua. They sell provisions, hairdressing and shoes, respectively. They have been together since 2011. 

Juliana is a 28-year-old provision seller who is married to Jacob, a 31 year civil servant. They are blessed with 2 children. She needs 1,500 GHS to buy more beans, biscuits, toffees, rice and chocolate to sell to her customers. Juliana has been in this business for the past 7 years and is doing very well. She is very loyal and truthful with all the loans she has taken from ID Ghana and is now applying for her fourth loan to meet her customers’ demands. 

The entire group needs an amount totaling 3,000 GHS to expand and buy more goods to meet the demand of their respective customers.

loans.use: to buy more beans, biscuits, toffees, rice and chocolate to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nayais

texts.en:
Nayais is a 31-year-old married woman. She has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over 10 years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During initial years of her business she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today, she is proud to be famous in her community for being the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members alone. She wants her business to grow, so she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR, to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand of her customers.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is married. He is a photographer and has run his business for about 12 years. He was one of the first photographers in the community. He is currently in the process of updating his studio with digital cameras which will enable him to take on all kinds of projects. What used to take him hours, now only takes minutes.

Geoffrey is seeking a loan to buy wood to make frames for his photos. He is very happy to have this opportunity which will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to buy wood to make frames for his photos.

loans.name: Noe Antonio

texts.es: Don Noe de 39 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde que estaba muy pequeño tiene buena experiencia en el cultivo de maiz y maicillo vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos con la venta que hace de sus cultivos lleva a su hogar lo necesario para sus gastos, es un hombre trabajador, honesto y responsable solicita el credito para invertir en compra de insumos agricolas para poder realizar sus cultivos de maiz y maicillo.
texts.en:
Don Noe is 39 years old and has been farming from a very young age. He has plenty of experience in growing corn and sorghum. Don Noe lives in his own home with his wife and children. He sells his crops in order to cover the necessary household expenses.

Don Noe is a hardworking, honest, and responsible man. He is requesting a loan so that he can invest in farming supplies so that he can grow his corn and sorghum crops.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma has been a merchant for years. She is hardworking and dedicated. Fatuma is married and has five children. Thanks to all of her efforts, her children are studying. She says that she never had the opportunity to study. Therefore, her greatest wish is to see all of her children become professionals so that they can have a better future.

Fatuma is engaged in a water selling business, supplying water to the people in her neighborhood. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase spare parts to repair her water tap.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair her water tap.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann has a green grocery business in Tala town. She sells vegetables, tomatoes, onions, potatoes and fruits too. She sells them both in wholesale and retail. She has been in the business for five years and it has been profitable. She is 29 years of age and married with one child.

This will be her first loan term and she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of grocery items for sale, including vegetables, bags of potatoes, and beans, as well as fruits such as mangoes, oranges and bananas. She anticipates generating more profits with which she plans to pay school fees for her child.

She hopes to grow her business by opening a bigger grocery shop in the area, making more income and being able to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: To buy more stock of vegetables, tomatoes and fruits.

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house for the past five years. Her husband also assists her, by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he is doing a marketing job.

Lubna is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good health and quality food and clothing. She wants her business to grow, so she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, oils, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, oils, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 25-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She has been running a business of trading cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community.

Nadia requested a loan of 20,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of different cloths for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy stock of different cloths for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers.

loans.name: Silvia Janet

texts.es: Doña Silvia de 46 años, tiene 5 años de tener su negocio de venta de productos de primera necesidad (cereales, huevos, frutas, bebidas, etc), vive con sus dos hijos (11 y 6 años). ella solicita financiamiento para incrementar el inventario de los productos y variar otros que sus clientes solicitan, por ello necesita $500
texts.en: Silvia is 46 years old. She has had her business for 5 years. She sells basic necessity products (grains, eggs, fruit, beverages, etc.). She lives with her two children (11 and 6). She is asking for the loan to increase her inventory of products and have more variety of some that her customers ask her for. To do that, she needs $500.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Safari

texts.en: This marks Safari's second loan after repaying the first one successfully. He will use the money to stock more sacks of charcoal to prepare for the coming long rains in the month of March. He hopes to make a great profit on the sales and venture into a second business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a 40-year-old married woman and mother of three. For the past 22 years, she has been running a business selling milk with the support of her husband. She started her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family. With the passage of time, her sales increased and so did her income. Now she has two buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination.

Because of her work, Zainab is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family and financial matters. She has some savings and applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her 6th loan cycle with good repayment history and is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Tehmina

texts.en: Tehmina is a 21-year-old woman and mother of two. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure, so she decided to work with her husband to support their family for a better future. Five years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of available funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers.
