For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, packs of lace, ribbons and zippers in various colors. This will enable her to meet the demands of her customers without fail.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, packs of lace, ribbons and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 30-year-old single man, who has been working in the telecommunication business for six years. In 2011, he opened his own shop selling mobile phones, to expand his business, and increase his income. Walid is a hardworking man. He owns a chicken selling shop too, but he likes the communication sector more and he is willing to invest a lot in developing it properly.
Walid is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase his supply of mobile phones and prepaid cards, to meet the needs  of the increasing number of customers he is happy to serve.
Walid hopes to be capable of developing both businesses as much as he can and he is looking forward to a brighter future.

loans.use: To increase his supply of mobile phones and prepaid cards

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 22-year-old mixed crop farmer. She is a married mother of two children. She has been doing farming business for the past four years. She earns a monthly income of KES 20,000, which she uses to support her family. She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. 

She plans to use the loan to purchase farm inputs and animal feed. She will use the anticipated profits to venture into beekeeping. Her hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and animal feed

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a hardworking, married woman and mother of three. She decided to work with her husband to support their family, hoping for a better future. She began stitching uniforms for the people of her community in her house and earns a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. At this time she has attained a regular list of customers. However, due to lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 20,000 PKR.

She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, packs of buttons and zippers to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, packs of buttons and zippers.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is a 43-year-old married woman and has been running a business of milk sales with her husband for 5 years. They have two buffalo and one cow and sell their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk.  She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband assists her in selling it door-to-door.

She is a mother of three children, two of whom are school going. She needs to earn more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to increase her sales, she requested a loan of Rs 20,000/- from Kashf Foundation to buy one more buffalo for milking. It will increase the milk production capacity which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo for milking.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 43-year-old, energetic, married woman and a mother of eight children. For the past three years, she has been running a business manufacturing waan, a material used in making charpoy (a bedstead of woven webbing or hemp stretched on a wooden frame on four legs, common in Pakistan).

She offers various kinds of waan in different colors and is famous for providing good quality waan in her community. This enables her to manage the needs of her family members. Her business requires improvement, so Khalida applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy another good machine to make the ‘waan’ with fresh quality thread, to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy another machine to make waan with fresh quality thread to increase her sales.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 30 years old, married to a teacher, and the father of two children, aged three years and one year. He is a livestock trader and has been running his business for the past three years, making a monthly income of KES 10,000.

Stephen is borrowing his first loan of KES 10,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to purchase more livestock for resale. 

The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost his business. His dream is to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to sell

loans.name: Ndeye's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois de Ndiouckème a été crée le 12 Décembre 2009. Il est composé de 38 membres ayant une bonne cohésion sociale et mènent toutes une activité qu'est l'embouche.

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, la vedette Mbène est âgée de 61 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 06 enfants dont 04 garçons et 02 filles. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter un boeuf à 100 000 frs et 03 moutons à 35 000 frs qu'elle élèvera, nourrira et revendra après un certain temps. 

Les bénéfices lui permettent de renforcer ses épargnes et d'aider un de ses enfants qui est à l'université.
texts.en:
The Banc Villageois in Ndiouckème was set up on 12th December 2009. It is made up of 38 members who have good social relations and all have animal fattening activities.

The star member, Mbène, who is standing on the right of the photo with her hand raised, is 61 years old. She is a widow and mother to six children: four boys and two girls.

With the loan she is receiving, she will buy an ox for 100,000 francs and three sheep for 35,000 francs, which she will raise, feed and sell after a while.

The profits she makes will allow her to boost her savings and help out one of her children, who is at university.

loans.use: to buy an ox and sheep which she will raise and resell.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has two school-going children. She owns a retail shop, a business she has been running for four years. She sells foodstuffs, household goods, and other items.

Bahati learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is lack of adequate finances for business expansion, a problem she sees partly addressed by this loan. 

Bahati is applying for a loan of 53,750 Kenyan shillings to buy grocery stock, such as maize, beans, rice, and cooking fat. The extra income resulting from the loan will be added to her savings to improve the livings standards of her family and pay school fees for her children. She aspires to open a mini wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy grocery stock such as maize, beans, rice, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She has been running a business of animal sales and purchase for many years with the support of her husband. She buys animals (baby goats) at low prices, brings them up, and sells them at higher prices. Her husband also assists her in buying and selling them in the market. She earns a good profit through her business and is able to meet the needs of the family members. In order to purchase two more goats, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 25,000. She wishes to spend part of the earnings on the betterment of her family members and dreams of providing a quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 37-year-old, vigorous, married woman. She has been doing hand-embroidery for the past four years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong, but business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is working in a factory, but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members.  She is a mother of four children and wants to grow her business. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; currently she is requesting a loan of Rs.35000 to buy raw materials such as spools of thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand of her customers. Robina dreams of opening her own shop to display her work in the market.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as spools of thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand of her customers.

loans.name: Bevi

texts.en: Bevi is a 53-year-old woman; she is successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has six years of experience in this field.  She has attained a regular list of customers and earns to contribute to the family income. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy stocks of rice and sugar and packs of salt and biscuits. She has been in association with Kashf Foundation for six years. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice and sugar and packs of salt and biscuits.

loans.name: Rosariah

texts.en:
Rosariah is a 29-year-old electronics technician in Barsheba, Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and works with her husband in their jointly owned electronics workshop. Together they support two people. She has been in this business for the last twelve years and has done great.

This marks her second loan from KADET LTD, and the first loan was repaid successfully. She will use the current loan to purchase electronics spare parts for her workshop, and the anticipated profit will repay her loan as well as help her to expand her workshop.   

In the future, Rosariah hopes to import spare parts directly instead of buying them from a middleman.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her electronics workshop

loans.name: Niterimbere Group

texts.fr:
Faustin  fait partie du groupe  Niterimbere  et  habite à Bujumbura. C’est un célibataire de  22 ans.
Il prend soin  de ses petits frères qui étudient. 

Il fait le commerce noix de palmier à huile depuis  3 ans. 

Il est à son  deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de noix de palmier à huile, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  avoir une maison et acheter un véhicule.
texts.en:
Faustin belongs to the Niterimbere group and lives in Bujumbura. He is a 22-year old single man and takes care of his brothers who are studying. 

He has been selling palm nuts for making oil for the past three years and is on his second loan from Turame. With the loan from KIVA he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of palm nuts for making oil, so he can earn more money. 

In the coming years he would like to have a house and buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of palm nuts for making oil that he can sell to earn more money.

loans.name: Cyte Lamy Group

texts.fr: Yacine est née le 04/06/1969, elle est Mariée et mère de 9 enfants dont 6 garçons et 3 filles.elle fait du commerce depuis son entrée dans le banc villageois et elle est très expérimenté dans le domaine de la friperies.Avec son prêt de 115000f elle compte acheter des balais de l'arachide et de la friperie qu'elle va revendre en détail au marché . Ses bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge la scolarité de ses enfants et renforce aussi ses épargnes dans le Banc villageois.
texts.en: Yacine was born on 4th June 1969. She is married and mother to nine children: six boys and three girls. She has been trading since she joined the Banc Villageois and she is very experienced in the field of second-hand clothing. With her loan of 115,000 francs she is planning to buy brooms, groundnut and second hand clothing, which she will sell on a retail basis at the market. Her profits will enable her to provide for her children's schooling and also boost her savings in the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to buy brooms, groundnut and bales of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Thambalkhong Mayai Leikai Group

texts.en:
Gambhini is a single mother with a son. She is pictured with her hand raised. Gambhini is the featured member of Thambalkhong Mayai Leikai Group. She runs a variety store in her village. She started her business with a very small amount of capital by selling paan, local cigarettes, candy, toffees, dried tobacco packs and vegetables like potatoes, onions and garlic. Her variety store is a winner in the village. People gather around the clock to buy things from her. Gambhini is very prudent with her daily expenses, so she has been able to save and restock with rice, sugar, vegetable oil, detergent soaps and detergent powder. Gambhini’s only son, who is 17 years old, also helps her run the variety store when he is on vacation.

Gambhini joined the group savings and contributes monthly. She is delighted to share this because she used to admire the other group members who were in a position to have savings in the group whereas she was not. With the upcoming loan, she wishes to stock more supplies in the store and hire someone to run errands for the store. She plans on this because she believes that this will enable the villagers not to travel all the way to the marketplace for small items like salt, sugar, etc., which will eventually be to her benefit.

Likewise, the other group members are also busy in their businesses and are working hard. Their businesses include weaving, tailoring and embroidery. They are hopeful for better and bigger outcomes in the days to come if Kiva continues to loan to them in the future too.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for her store for refills.

loans.name: Ahoefa

texts.fr: Revendeuse de friperies dans une boutique, Ahoefa est une jeune femme de 30ans. Elle est mariée à un informaticien et a deux enfants en charge. Ces derniers âgés de 10 et 07ans sont scolarisés. Afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, elle fait son second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des habits. Elle espère augmenter le stock afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients et  subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Ahoefa, who is a young 30-year old woman, sells second-hand clothing in a shop. She is married to a computer technician and has two children in her care. They are ten and seven years old respectively and both go to school. In order to respond better to customer demand, she is getting a second loan from WAGES to buy clothes. She hopes to increase her stock so that she can better respond to client demand and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She has been doing work stitching clothes for many years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching for the people of her community and contributes to her family income. However, due to a lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loanto buy more spools of thread in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons, to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a better source of income. She is in her 5th loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors and packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 28-year-old, energetic, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house for three years. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en: Zareena is a 39-year-old married woman; she has been doing hand embroidery work for many years. She started doing this work with her daughters, and over time her embroidery patterns have become popular in her territory. Due to increased demand of her embroidery designs, she is including other women in her business. Her husband is not in a good physical shape to support her family. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education. In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers she needs to engage some more women. Now she has requested a loan of Rs.20000 from Kashf Foundation. In this way she can buy more frames, needles, spools of threads, and packs of sequins of different colors, which will help in generating more income. She is in her 5th loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles, spools of threads and packs of sequins

loans.name: Harun

texts.en:
Harun is 52 years old and lives in Kaloleni. He is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. He makes his living selling fruits and vegetables. Thanks to this work and valuable help from his wife, the family is able to get ahead.

Harun considers himself to be an honest and hard-working person who is very responsible when it comes time to meet his obligations. He says that everything he does is for the good of his family, since he wants to offer them the best of everything. His dream is to have a small store in which to sell his products. In addition, he says that he very meticulous in his work, since he has been been dedicated to taking care of produce and fruit for re-sale for a long time. Thanks to his work, he has been able to develop a good clientele that always purchases their produce from him.

Harun is requesting the loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables, which will help him to supply his business and meet his customers demands. He is grateful to Yehu Microfinance for the opportunity they are offering him, since getting the loan will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 34 years old, married, and has been blessed with four kids aged 7,8, 12 and 14 years. 

She is a tailor (dress making) and she has been in business for eight years. Right now her monthly income is KES. 15,000. She is borrowing a loan of  KES.40,000 to buy sewing materials and also pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and also pay school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a modern charcoal stove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a modern charcoal stove.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a hardworking gentleman aged 32. He is married to Hamisi and the father of two children, aged 10 and two years old. He operates a motorcycle transport business while his wife sells secondhand clothing.

Paul learned about KADET LTD from one of his customers who is a registered member. He has acquired his first loan of KES 10,000, which will facilitate the repair of his broken motorcycle.

He hopes to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children as well as to expand his wife's clothing business. Paul's hope and dream is to own a fleet of taxis.

loans.use: to repair his broken motorcycle

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old married man and the father of one child. He has been working in the food business for fifteen years. He was only 14 years old when he quit school and began working in order to help his family in making their living and covering their expenses.

Ali opened his own bakery in November 2011, and it is going just fine because of his special talent and long experience in this field and because of his special customer service and menu. He sells special Lebanese "manakish," which is a traditional breakfast. It is similar to a pizza but it is folded and has a variety of toppings such as thyme, cheese, and meat, upon customers' requests. He also prepares and sells pizzas, which his customers claim are delicious just like like everything he prepares.

Ali is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy a car for both his business and social life. He hopes that one day he will be capable of buying the shop he is in and save the rent expenses to develop his business and improve his family's social and financial conditions.

loans.use: To buy a car

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married and has two children who attend school and also help her in the business whenever possible. Margaret sells perfumes and silver jewelry. She has had the business for two years. She has varied a clientele and gets help from her partner, with whom she has been together for years. Together, they get ahead.

Margaret is requesting this loan to buy perfumes and silver jewelry such as chains, medals, rings, bracelets, and other items that will allow her to offer more variety to her customers and thus improve her income.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and silver jewelry

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 30-year-old single woman who has been selling clothes for a year and a half. Her business is developing but needs an external financial push in order to better meet customer needs, especially since Fatima is new in the market.

For this reason, Fatima applied for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her merchandise with special spring/summer collections. Fatima hopes to keep working hard, increasing her business capital, and developing her social and financial situations. In addition to selling clothes, Fatima also specializes in repairing clothes, which provides her with added income.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise with special spring/summer collections

loans.name: Ekow Zakaria

texts.en:
Ekow Zakaria is a farmer. He produces charcoal, firewood and also cultivates cassava to sell at Asebu Brebia near Cape Coast. Ekow has completed middle school form four. He is single. Ekow has been in this business for 15 years now. Ekow uses his income to pay his utility and accommodation bills.   

He will use his loan to hire labor to work on his farm with him this harvest season.  Ekow plans to expand his farm with his new profits.

loans.use: to hire labor to work on his farm with him this harvest season.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 33 years old and married. She operates a clothing stall in the Bomet area. She has been running the business for two years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

She has borrowed her first loan of KES 10,000 from KADET LTD. She will use it to buy more clothing for her business. 

The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her sister's children. Her dreams are to improve her living standard and to own her residential plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 35-year-old, hardworking gentleman. He is married to a teacher, and a father of two children, ages one and three years. He runs a private school, while his wife teaches in a county public school. He has run the business for the past five years, earning a monthly income of KES 40,000.

He learned about KADET LTD from a parent of one of his pupils. He has acquired his first loan of KES 7,500, which will enable him to purchase text books, chalk, and other learning materials. 

He will use the anticipated profits to build more classrooms for the growing learning institution. His hope and dream is to own an institution of higher learning.

loans.use: buying textbooks, chalk and other learning materials  for the students

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is married and operates a small hair salon. She wants to remodel her salon, in order to offer her clients a more comfortable environment, and to generate more income to help support her family. She is requesting this loan in order to help grow her business.

She is a very hardworking person with a persistent spirit and attitude. She has much experience in her field, and knows what she is doing. Her goal is to one day have a large beauty salon, and to be widely known for her talent. She is grateful for this opportunity, and believes that the support will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to remodel her beauty salon.

loans.name: Simeon

texts.en:
Simeon is doing well in his tailoring business. He has expanded it, and now he makes school uniforms, suits and dresses. Also, he has started selling secondhand clothes to his customers.

He paid the loan he had been advanced on time, and now he has borrowed a loan of KES 100,000, which he intends to use to purchase materials and other textile items for his business.

His hopes and dreams are to be a successful businessman and be able to give his children the best education.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials.

loans.name: Macmillan

texts.en:
Macmillan lives in Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has six school-going children. He owns a dairy farm and a crop-farming business that he has been operating for five years. He started the business through his own savings. Macmillan also owns rental houses, and the family earns some income from this.

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. The main challenges he is facing are drought and occasional low seasons. He would therefore like to invest in other sources of income, preferably transport. Motorcycles are used very often for this because of the bad road network.

Macmillan is applying for a loan of 83,500 Kenya shillings to buy a motorcycle. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the education of his children. His future plans are to buy cars for transporting his dairy milk and buy some broilers for the poultry firm.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 52 years old and married. He supports a family of four children as well as other two adults who depend on him. His spouse runs a small scale farming business which helps in producing some additional income. 

Francis runs a posho mill (cereals milling). He has been in this business for the last ten years, and his monthly income is KES. 18,000.

He has borrowed his fourth loan of KES. 50,000 which he intends to use to purchase maize and millet for milling. He plans to use the additional income to expand the business and save some to educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase cereals for milling.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah benefited from the previous loan by buying more stock which expanded her business and allowed her to meet her customers’ demands.

Annah has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loan. She hopes to use the loan amount to buy more vegetables and potatoes to stock and sell.

She hopes to buy a plot of land and build rental houses in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and potatoes.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is 45 years old, married, and a mother of six children. For the past two years, she has earned a living by selling clothes in Mpeketoni, Lamu. She earns a monthly profit of KES 12,000. 

Ann was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. Now she is applying for her second loan of KES. 25,000, to buy additional stock of clothes for resale to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to pay for her children's school fees and to expand her business.

Her goal for the future is to continue growing her business, so that she can help give her family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of clothes for resale

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline has already paid her first loan. She is willing to take another loan from KADET LTD to expand her business, she still practices mixed farming and she succeeded with the first loan. She used the first loan to buy tomato and green pepper seeds for the greenhouse farming.

She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD and will use the loan to purchase a dairy cow and also buy farm inputs to use in the Greenhouse to generate more income.

Evaline’s business has grown and their life has changed, living happily with their family members.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Job

texts.en:
Job is 50 years old and married. He supports a family of four children, as well as two other adults who depend on him. His wife runs a small-scale farming business, which helps by producing some additional income.  

Job runs a posho mill (a machine for processing grains) in Eldama Ravine division of Baringo County. He has been in business for the past six years, and his monthly income from the business is KES 20,000. This loan is his fourth from KADET LTD; He has borrowed KES. 50,000 which he intends to use the loan to purchase maize for milling. 

He plans to use part of the additional income to expand the business, and save part of it to educate his children. His hope and dream is to be a well-known and accomplished cereals trader in the Baringo County.

loans.use: To purchase dried maize for milling

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly, a 26-year-old single lady who supports two people, sells milk at her milk bar. This has been her income-generating business for the last four years, earning her an average monthly income of KES. 12,000. Now requesting her first loan of KES. 10,000 from KADET LTD to purchase more fresh milk from farmers to sell, Nelly hopes to be financially stable and save enough money to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh milk from farmers to sell.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 25 years old and married to a lady who helps in producing some additional income. He runs a motorcycle transport business in Nakuru County, a business that has been operational for the last five years. He makes a monthly income from the business of KES 15,000. 

He has borrowed his fourth loan of KES. 40,000 which he intends to use to purchase more stock for his new baking business.


He plans to use the additional income generated to re-invest back into the business and save for the future. He hopes to purchase a car and venture into the taxi transport service.

loans.use: To purchase baking ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items like soda, water, etc.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province. He is married and has one child. He owns a carpentry workshop, which he has been operating for five years. He started the business with his little savings.

He learned about Milango through friends, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenge he is facing is purchasing stock.

Moses is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings, to buy timber, nails, and equipment for the workshop. His extra income from the loan will be added to savings, and later used to repair broken machines and service them. His future plans are to expand the business and to own a larger outlet.

loans.use: To buy timber, nails and equipment for the carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Glarice

texts.en:
Glarice lives in the Kilifi area of Coast province. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She owns a carpentry workshop, which she has been operating for four years. She started the business with her little savings. She also runs a dairy farm. In the carpentry business, she makes beds, tables, chairs, and the like.

She learned about Milango through friends, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenge she is facing is the high cost of purchasing stock.

Glarice is applying for a loan of 43,200 Kenyan shillings to buy timber, varnish, nails, and other materials for the workshop. Her extra income from the loan will be added to savings, to repair broken machines and service them. Her future plans are to expand the business and to own a larger outlet. She believes this will improve her family's status.

loans.use: To buy timber, varnish, nails, and other materials for the workshop.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is a 61-year-old married man and father of one child. He has been working as a taxi driver for eighteen years. He used to work as a tailor but he changed to a daily income business to improve his family's living. His car is his only way for making his living, so he has to keep it in  good shape as much as he can. Unfortunately, he is facing mechanical problems with his car. That's why he applied for his first loan cycle from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to change his car's engine as soon as possible to keep providing his family with the requested daily income necessary for living.

loans.use: To change his taxi's engine

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Fausta is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. She is a charcoal seller and has been doing this business for five years. Fausta is a married mother of one school-going child. She began the business from an informal savings scheme called ‘merry go round’; where a group contributes equal amounts of money and lends to one person at a time.
She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 53,800 Kenya shillings to purchase a new stock of charcoal and fuel wood to sell. She will pay for her child's school fee from the extra income. 
Despite the challenge of the high cost of transportation, Fausta believes the business has a future. As well as using the income to educate her child, she looks forward to owning a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a new stock of charcoal and fuel wood to sell.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya.  He is married and has two children. He owns a service shop which sells bottled water. He is also a contractor, dealing in electrical work.
Solomon learned about Milango through advertisements and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenges are competition and lack of finance, a problem he sees partly sorted by this loan.
Solomon is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy bottled water to sell. He believes that the business has improved enough to meet the required repayments for the loan despite the high competition, and he will be able to effectively provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy bottled water to sell.

loans.name: Ablam

texts.fr: Jeune dame de 39ans, Ablam est mère de 2 enfants âgés de 07 et 04ans. Elle est couturière de profession et en même temps revendeuse de produits de mercerie, des pagnes et divers. Son premier crédit de WAGES lui servira d’acheter des marchandises pour mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle compte élargir son activité et assurer un avenir meilleur à sa famille.
texts.en: Ablam is a 39 year-old young lady, and has two children aged 7 and 4. She works as a tailor and also sells haberdashery products, pagnes (colourful fabrics) and other assorted wares. Her first WAGES loan will enable her to purchase merchandise in other to meet her customers' demands. She aims to grow her business and ensure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase haberdashery products

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a resident of the Kilifi area of Coast province, Kenya. She is a married mother of ten children. She owns a retail business, where she deals in selling of roofing materials, locally known as “makut." These are preferred at the coast, which experiences a lot of heat during the day, for their insulating capabilities. Zawadi also sells fish and clothes.

She was introduced to Milango by her friends, and she is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenyan shillings. She will use the loan to purchase more roofing materials and clothes to sell. The challenge that the business faces is bad debts, especially on roofing materials, as a result of inflation. She will use the extra income from the loan to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase more roofing materials and clothes to sell

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is married and has three children.  Nelia is 61 years old and lives in Tuyabang Alto, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philipines.
To earn a living, she has a hog fattening business. She has had this business for eight years. Nelia has been a member of PMPC for eight years.
In the future, Nelia hopes to expand her business and provide more income for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase  pigs for her hog fattening business.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tuyabang Alto Oroquieta City Misamis Occ

loans.name: Norce

texts.en:
Norce is 41 years old and lives in Mialen, Clarin, Philippines. She is married and has five children.  Norce has a musical business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to an purchase additional sound system.
Norce has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Norce hopes to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional sound system

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: Marife is married and has four children.  She is 41 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Philippines.  Marife is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional feeds.  Marife has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Marife hopes to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds

loans.name: Zosema

texts.en:
Zosema is married and has five children.  She is 52 years old and lives in Poblacion 1, Clarin, Philippines.  Zosema sells a variety of items to earn a living and has had this business for 11 years. Each month, she earns PHP 8000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents ,etc.
Zosema has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, Zosema hopes to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Selly

texts.en:
Selly  is 28 years old and lives in Tuyabang Alto, Oroquieta City,  Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has two children.  Selly has a hog fattening business.  She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of 10,000Pesos to purchase more pigs for her business.
Selly has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, she hopes to own a house an a lot someday.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs

location.town: Oroquieta-Tuyabang Alto Oroquieta City Misamis Occ

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a 31 year-old married woman and a mother of four children, from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in the hog raising business for more than two years now.  Her husband works as a farmer.

Maricel is asking for a loan to buy feeds for the pigs and to pay her school fees for the children. With this loan, Maricel will be able to improve her hog raising business.

loans.use: to buy feeds for the pigs and to pay her school fees for the children

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is married woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She has two children. The eldest is 21 and the youngest is 16 yeasr old. She has been engaged in the farming business for 20 years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband is a farmer, too.

Milagros is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, medicine, and chemicals. This will be used to make the crops grow faster and free from insects.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy what she needs to make her farm grow productively. In the future, Milagros hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, medicine, chemical

loans.name: Virgilina

texts.en:
Virgilina is a 36 year-old married woman and a mother of seven young children, from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than 19 years now.

Virgilina is asking for a loan to buy a new boat engine and fishing nets. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Virgilina hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.  Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine and fishing nets

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is a married woman and a mother of five grown children from Bien Unido, Bohol.  She has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than 13 years now. This is the source of their income.

Felicia needs a loan to buy new fishing nets and materials for the repair of the fishing boat, like plywood, nails and paint. With a loan, Felicia will be able to improve their fishing business, thus increasing their income. In the future, Felicia hopes to make their fishing business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, and materials for the repair of the fishing boat, like plywood, nails and paint

loans.name: Venerando

texts.en:
Venerando is a married man of 46 from Bien Unido, Bohol. He has seven children. The eldest is 20 and the youngest is three years old. He has been engaged in the fishing business for 20 years now. This is the source of his income.

Venerando is requesting a loan to buy fish nets, lead weights, and floaters. These are the materials used in catching fishes. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy what he needs for his business. In the future, Venerando hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, lead weights, floaters.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en: Rafael is a 43 year-old married man and a father of seven children. They live in San Miguel, Bohol. He has been engaged in the farming business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of his income.  Rafael is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, he will be able to improve his farming business and its harvest and yield. In the future, Rafael hopes to expand his business to make it more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a 48 year-old married woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She has six children. The eldest is 28 and the youngest is12 years old. She has been engaged in the farming business for four years now. This is the source of her income.

Zenaida is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. This will be used to make her crops grow healthy and free from insects. With the help of this loan, she will be able to make her business productive.  In the future, Zenaida hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides

loans.name: Solidad

texts.en:
Solidad is a dried fish vendor from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of five children. Solidad has been engaged in the fish vending business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income. 
As of now, Solidad is asking for a loan to buy more fish to dry and sell. With this, she will be able sell more and increase her income.  In the future, Solidad hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry and sell

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is a 47 year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has seven children. The eldest is 26 and the youngest is 15 year old. She is engaged in the fish selling business and has been in this business with her husband for 26 years now. 

Mirasol is requesting a loan for additional capital and to repair her boat. Additional capital is for her business. She also wants to repair her boat because this is the source of her income. This will be used in catching fishes. With the help of this loan, she will repair her boat and re-start her business.
In the future, Mirasol hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to have additional capital and to repair her boat

loans.name: Venice

texts.en:
Venice is a 31 year-old married woman and a mother of five young children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than 10 years now.

Venice is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and hooks. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and hooks

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en: Annabel is a 33-year-old farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of four young children. Annabel is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve their farming business and its yield. In the future, Annabel dreams of making her farming business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert, a 37-year-old married father of three children, also takes care of four orphans who are children of his late brother, who died in a car accident two years ago. He provides all of their basic needs and is paying their tuition from the little income he earns from their family business.

Robert started a retail shop business in 2005 as a way to support his family and to improve their social status. This has helped him to support his children and those of his late brother in school, hence brightening their future. His major challenge is lack of sufficient capital to boost his business and at the same time look after his family.

He has managed the shop for such a long time because of his good customer service and his positive work attitude. He dreams of growing his enterprise by opening up other outlets to increase his income and also see that his children and dependents get quality educations. He is requesting this loan to buy more retail shop items such as soft drinks and household products.

His neighbors applaud him as a very hardworking, determined, dedicated and ambitious businessman. In the photo is Robert with his wife and child.

loans.use: To buy retail shop items such as soft drinks and other daily household products.

loans.name: Alafia A Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Alafia A” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT and Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 700,000 SLL for each member in order to invest in their respective businesses.
Fatmata is the featured leader of this group. Fatmata is 50-year-old, she is married with 5 children. A native of Freetown, Fatmata sells market-food – rice, palm-oil, tomatoes, pepper, onions, etc. and has been doing this for many years now. With the help of this loan, Fatmata will invest in her business by buying the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm-oil, tomatoes, pepper, onions, etc.

loans.name: Alafia B Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Alafia B” group from Waterloo, a town near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. They are petty-businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to seek a loan of 3,100,000 Sierra Leonean leones  for the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their respective businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Mariatu. Mariatu was born in western Sierra Leone 41 years ago. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a fisherman and 5 of her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Mariatu has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells firewood and charcoal. She has requested this loan in order to buy firewood and charcoal in larger quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy firewood and charcoal in larger quantities to add to her current stock

loans.name: Hope To God Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Hope To God 1” group from Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions.
Kadiatu is the featured leader of this group. The 44-year-old is married to a fisherman and they have 2 children. Fatmata has been a businesswoman for many years now, she sells dried fish. With her share of this loan, she will buy a basket-full of dried fish to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy a basket-full of dried fish to add to her business.

loans.name: Zaza

texts.en:
Zaza is 37 years old from a small village in the Batumi district. He has a large family: a wife, 19-year-old son, 17-year-old daughter and his parents. Zaza requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions.

Zaza’s wife is a math teacher, his mother is a chemistry teacher and his father teaches fitness at a local school. They all get a monthly income but it is hardly enough for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Zaza requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. His loan request was approved in the frames of new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country’s rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Zaza will install chairs and windows in his minibus. After the chairs are installed he will be able to transport local passengers. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to install chairs and windows in his minibus to allow transport of passengers.

loans.name: Norah's Group

texts.en: Hanifa is a widow with six children. She also looks after other three dependents, who are orphans. She is a member of the Tebuyoleka Group. She wants a loan to pay school fees for the many children. Her dream is to buy a plot of land and build a house for her children near the city, and thus to get relief from the burden of renting. Her main challenge is that business is slow and, at times, she spends three days without making any sales, yet she still has to meet the needs of her family. However, with the loans, she believes the status of the business will change, because she will be able to buy a variety of food items to make her business competitive. She is a hard-working woman. The twelfth member of the group, right rear, is the group secretary, who is in a different sub-group and signed a waiver form for this loan.

loans.use: to buy plantains, sweet potatoes and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Fahd

texts.en: Fahd is 31 years old and a married man, living in Hodeidah, Yemen. He has 3 children. He is a hardworking man and tries his best to provide his family’s expenses. He started a small café many years ago. His brothers work in the café. He intended to use the profit that he has saved to buy a bus for transportation but that amount is not enough to buy a bus. So he requested a loan of 500,000 YER from AMB to buy a bus. This improvement will enable him to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy a bus for transportation.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is a 43-year-old married man who has 4 children and lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a hardworking man. He purchased land, which enabled him to build part of his house. He would like to complete his building but he doesn’t have sufficient money.
So he is requesting a loan of 200,000 YER to cover the costs of purchasing construction supplies. This will ensure him better living conditions.

loans.use: to cover the costs of purchasing construction supplies.

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en: Sophy, 33, lives in a rural area of the Ponhea Leur district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She has four children. To support her family, she has been farming rice, while her husband works in a garment factory, to better support her family. The current business earns their family approximately KHR 29,000 per day, and they can save about KHR 5,000 each day after daily expenses. Sophy’s Group consists of five members who live in the same village.  This is her first microloan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy materials to build a proper, healthy, latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a proper latrine for her family.

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en: Prossy is a young and determined member of the group, founded in the outskirts of the city. Prossy buys scrap metal and sells it to recyclers, as well as a few electric appliances. This is a business she began immediately after she dropped out of school due to lack of tuition funds, because her father had many other children and gave priority to the boys. She got married at a tender age, but she wanted to be actively involved in business, so with a few resources from her husband, she started selling scrap and some electrical appliances. She will use the proceeds of her loan to buy electrical appliances. She has challenges, such as the theft of metals around the village, coupled with buying fake metals which aren’t easily sold. Despite all the challenges she goes through, she cannot leave the business because she has to take care of her young children, as her husband's meager resources are inadequate. She is a determined and resilient woman.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances and scrap metal to sell.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 38-year-old man who lives with his family in Taiz, Yemen. He is married and has three children. He is very enthusiastic, and hardworking. He works very hard to cover his family’s expenses.
Thanks to his entrepreneurial spirit and the money he was able to save, he set up his own pharmacy. His wish is to support himself and help his family. He would like to expand his pharmacy but he lacks the money to do so.
So he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to be able to buy more medicine, supplies, etc. to stock his store. This will increase his sales and his income.

loans.use: to buy more medicine, supplies, etc. to stock his pharmacy.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 41-year-old conservative woman. She let her daughter take her place in the photo.

Rana is caring for two girls and two boys. Her oldest is Haneen, a 19-year-old single lady. Haneen is a university student majoring in Information Technology. Rana is applying for an educational loan to help her daughter pay for her semester registration fees.

loans.use: to help her daughter pay for her semester registration fees.

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en: In the photo are members of the Unity Group. They are small-scale businessmen based in Waterloo, a town in western Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profits, and consequently improve their standard of living. The leader of this group is 30-year-old Julius. Julius was born in Kono, but he is currently residing in Waterloo, with his wife and three children. His wife is also in business, and two of his children are attending primary school. For many years, Julius has been selling electrical appliances. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy electrical appliances in large quantity to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances in large quantity to add to his business.

loans.name: Hamzeh

texts.en:
Hamzeh is a 22-year-old married young man. He lives with his wife in Khanyounis and has no children yet. 

Hamzeh is an ambitious young man. He wants to assess fees for his own projects to have a stable source of income to live in better conditions.

Hamzeh is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing new laptop to start working as a graphic designer. His mother is employed and will help her son Hamzeh in the repayments. 

Taking this loan will ensure Hamzeh a bright future and enable him to start his own work. This will offer to him a good source of income and the ability to live with his wife in better living conditions. 

Hamzeh appears in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase new laptop

loans.name: Faten

texts.en: Faten is a 39-year-old woman married to a Syrian man who is a vocational worker. Their son Fadi is a 19-year-old university student. Faten is applying for a loan to pay for her son’s semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s semester fees.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 21-year-old single guy. He is a student in the university studying Politics. He is the youngest of three children. Ahmad is applying for an educational loan to pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Lujain

texts.en: Lujain is 20 years old and the oldest sister of three girls and one boy. They are now depending on their mother for after their father passed away. Lujain is applying for an educational loan to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 22-year-old single guy. He has 5 siblings. Mohammad works in a taekwondo center to make a living. He also goes to the university to study Finance and Banking. Mohammad is now applying for an educational loan to support himself in paying for his semester fees.

loans.use: pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en: Rawan is a 21-year-old university student. She is studying to become a teacher. Rawan lives with her parents and 5 siblings. She is applying for an educational loan to pay for her current semester registration fees.

loans.use: to pay for her current semester registration fees as she studies to become a teacher.

loans.name: Wafeeqa

texts.en:
Wafeeqa is a 46-year-old conservative woman. She asked her son Fares to appear in the photo instead.
Wafeeqa is a mother of 7 sons and a daughter. One of them is Fares, a 24-year-old single guy who is a university student studying Medical Laboratory Sciences. She is now applying for a loan to pay for her sons’ semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her sons’ semester fees to study Medical Laboratory Sciences.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her current semester fees to study History.

loans.name: Inas

texts.en: Inas, is a 22-year-old single lady. She is the youngest of 4 children. Inas is seeking to get a bachelor’s degree at the university. She is now applying for an educational loan to pay for her current semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her current semester fees as she studies to get her bachelor's degree.

loans.name: Waad

texts.en: Waad has recently passed her high school exams that allows her to enter the university. She is a single lady that has five brothers and 2 sisters. Now Waad is applying for an educational loan to support her at the university and pay for her first semester’s fees.

loans.use: pay for her first semester fees.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en: Ibtisam is a 50-year-old conservative woman. She let her son Yazan appear in the photo in her place. Ibtisam is a mother of four. One of her children is Yazan, a 19-year-old single guy who has recently passed his high school exams and enrolled in one of the Jordanian universities. Ibtisam is applying for a loan to pay for her son's registration fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son's registration fees.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is a 22-year-old lady, studying English language at one of the Jordanian Universities. Since she depends on herself for a living, she decided to take an educational loan to be able to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees as she studies English at university.

loans.name: Gharam

texts.en: Gharam is 21 years old. She is the oldest sister for three brothers and one sister. Gharam could not register into a university but she was able to enroll into one of the Jordanian Diploma colleges. She is applying for an educational loan to support her in paying for the semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a 45-year-old married woman. She is a mother to eight sons and five daughters. Her husband is a worker and receives a low salary which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

Farida is a successful woman. For the past seven years, Farida has been raising and selling sheep and sheep products, which has been a profitable project and a second helper source of income to her family. However, her business also needs more support to get bigger and make improvements.

Farida is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the costs of purchasing more sheep. This will increase the capital of the project and increase sales in order to improve the family's income.

Farida is pictured next to the sheep she is raising.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 48-year-old conservative woman. She asked her son to take her place in the photo.
Najah is a mother of three sons and one daughter, who is now married. One of her sons is Mohammad, a 23-year-old university student who still has around one year before graduating with a bachelor’s degree in Mechatronics Engineering. Now Najah is applying for an educational loan to support her son and pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: pay for her son's semester fees as he completes his last year of studying Mechatronics Engineering.

loans.name: Awatef

texts.en: Awatef is a 21-year-old married lady. She has one son. Besides being a mom, Awatef goes to the university to study School Student Guidance. She is now applying for a loan to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees as she studies School Student Guidance (guidance counselor)

loans.name: Myassar

texts.en: Myassar is a 55-year-old widow. She has 6 children, where most of them are university students. For that she has applied for an educational loan to pay part of their semester fees.

loans.use: to pay part of her children's semester fees.

loans.name: Motaz

texts.en:
Motaz is a 31-year-old single young man. He is employed and receives a low salary which is not enough to cover all his needs.

Motaz wants to improve his housing conditions, so he is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing and installing new windows to his house. Taking this loan will offer to Motaz better living conditions and enable him to enjoy living in his house.

Motaz appears in the photo.

loans.use: To install new windows to his house

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 47-year-old married man with ten children and out of them seven attend school in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He generates income from goat rearing alongside selling agricultural produce, a business he has had for eight years. He has the challenge of inadequate capital to meet the customers’ demands, while his personal goals are educating his children and building a residential home as well as a business goal of expanding his business to become a ranch. Patrick wants a loan to buy goats for rearing and after sometime to sell them.

loans.use: to buy goats for rearing and after sometime resell them.

loans.name: Efrat

texts.en:
Efrat is a 40-year-old mother of six from Jerusalem. She has significant experience in alternative medicine treatments and acupuncture. Efrat works for a major Israeli health provider part time providing alternative medical treatments. She works from her home and has begun with a private clinic in Jerusalem. She rents a treatment room, and pays on a by-the-use basis. When she schedules treatments, she reserves the room and pays a rental fee. The clinic is a women’s healthcare center and provides a warm, welcoming and professional environment. With the fact that she only pays for the rental on a per-use basis, Efrat is keeping her overhead low while expanding her client base.
Efrat needed this loan to pay for equipment, advertising and publicity.
Efrat wants to grow her private clinic and see her business thrive on its own, one day expanding and training other caregivers.

loans.use: to pay for equipment, advertising and publicity for a women's healthcare clinic.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a father of two girls and one boy. He is still working in the car repair shop. 

The previous loan has helped in increasing the quantity of car oil they have available to cover the shop’s and the customers’ needs. He is now applying for another loan to buy more tires and new tools for the shop.

loans.use: to get more tires and new tools

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a hardworking, 34 year-old married man with 7 children living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. He got his start operating a small restaurant, which allowed him to save money for the general merchandise to stock the retail shop and to help him look after his family. John has six years' experience and he works at least 12 hours a day. His business is located in a trading center that attracts many customers. However, he has a challenge of inadequate capital to meet people’s demands. Therefore, John is requesting a loan to purchase sugar, soap, rice, salt, and sodas for the retail shop. John dreams of becoming a wholesaler and building a permanent residence for his family.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, rice, salt, and sodas for his retail shop.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 57-year-old married man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. For 30 years now he has been an agriculturalist, growing crops and rearing poultry. The business has been very lucrative, and in a day he collects over 300 eggs which he sells to restaurants near by.

Charles intends to use the loan to buy poultry feed. High cost of feed and diseases affect his business growth. His dreams are to educate his children up to university and to buy more chicks that can provide him with eggs to supply his current market and venture into new ones.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, a 27-year-old, hardworking married man, lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda, with his three children aged 6, 4 and 2. For the past year, he has been in the transport business as a motorcycle driver, working to help meet his family's basic needs. It is a challenging job, thanks to poor roads (especially in the rainy season, when they become almost impassable) coupled with high fuel and transportation costs. 

David has a personal goal of building a permanent house and venturing into agriculture. He is requesting this loan so he can buy land for both cultivation and construction purposes.

loans.use: to buy land for cultivation and construction.

loans.name: Lenard

texts.en: Lenard is a 35-year-old man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer who grows a variety of foods which he sells to the local market. Like most farmers he is challenged by unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuation, both of which affect his projected yields. He has a business plan to venture into modern farming, and dreams of building rental houses and educating his children up to the university level. Lenard intends to use the loan to buy seedlings and pay labor.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and pay labor.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en:
22-year-old Harrison used his previous loan to buy general merchandise to sell. He is a married man with one child living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. After failing to continue with school, he decided to set up a retail shop with money he had saved up from from casual labor and coffee sales, both of which he still does. 

Harrison is the bread winner of the family and his dream is to educate his child up to the university level and own a wholesale shop. His limited capital can make it difficult to meet the increasing demands of his customers. Harrison intends to use this loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchadise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his own school fees.

loans.name: Ngailut Dailou Group

texts.en:
Ngailut Dailou, which stands for “The Eternal Love”, is the name of the group and Lhingjanei is the featured member. She has her hand raised in the photo. “It is hard growing up without a father, but its easy when you have a fantastic mother who plays both roles” was the word of her only son who is married with kids. He’s a graduate and a very responsible person.  

Lhingjanei sheepishly quotes that “Chickens are her lucky charm” as she had tried her hands on other income-generating activities that ended in vain.  Chicken selling gives her more of what she wants and makes good money when she sells them in the market.  She has been into this chicken selling business for many years. She raises them in her home yard and takes the fully-grown chickens to the bi-weekly market, which falls on Tuesday and Friday.

With the loan, she will buy chicks, feed and materials to construct a bigger chicken coop. She will continue her chicken selling business and will try to do some savings with the group members. This savings will be beneficial when Lhingjanei is not in the position to earn or engage herself in any form of income-generating activity. She also shares that her savings will act as a pension when she gets old.

The members say, “Kiva is a blessing in disguise for our group and we are looking forward to them helping us. We will also try our best to work in unity and always keep our words. Long live Kiva”.

loans.use: To buy chicks, feed and materials to construct a bigger chicken coop.

loans.name: Ame

texts.fr: Mère de 02 enfants tous scolarisés âgés de 13 et 08ans, madame Ame a pour conjoint un chauffeur et est âgée de 40ans. Pour aider ce dernier dans les charges du foyer, elle fait un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des pagnes et des produits de  mercerie activité qu’elle associe à sa profession de couture depuis 2006. Avec le bénéfice de cette vente, elle veut assurer le développement de son activité tout en assurant l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Ame is the mother of two children, aged 13 and 8, who both go to school.  She is 40 years old and married to a driver.  

In order to help her husband provide for the family, she is taking a first loan with WAGES.  She will use her loan to buy some "pagnes" (colorful West-African fabrics) and sewing supplies.  She has been adding this retail business to her main professional activity (sewing) since 2006.

With the profits from her sales, she wants to ensure the development of her activity and the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes" and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Mary Lom Group

texts.en:
Tingbem is pictured with her hand raised and she is with the Mary Group. She has been running a paan shop in the village for the past eight years and earns extra income for the family by engaging in weaving. Life in her village gives fewer chances to Tingbem to earn and she finds it hard to refill her stock for paan-dukan due to lack of capital.  She sells essential commodities like peas, chili, sugar, onion, etc. In the day time, she is busy running her paan dukan and at night she weaves for additional income. Her woven products include traditional shawls, wraparound skirts, and scarves for women in general.  Tingbem takes orders and weaves accordingly. Tingbem plans to use this loan to refill her store's stock and buy more yarn for weaving. In the future, she wishes to expand her Paan Dukan into a General Store and own a shop in the market where she could sell her woven products in abundance. This loan will help her fulfill this dream.

Tingbem's husband is engaged in the construction of houses. His income depends entirely on the amount of work available. Thus, Tingbem hopes to get advanced carpentry tools for her husband when she is able to make a profit from the loan she avails. She wanted her husband to be independent in earning his own wages since he was working under the head construction workers. Due to the family’s poor financial condition, she believes that by availing this loan she could improve her family financial status. Her present plan is to build a house for themselves and to send her kids to private Institutions. For this purpose, together with her husband, Tingbem works hard.
 
The extension of a Kiva and WSDS loan will act as a helping hand in bringing up her kids and running her business and empower her social and financial status.

She sends millions of hugs and kisses to all the lenders.

loans.use: To buy stock for her shop and yarn.

loans.name: New Saikul Women Shg Society Group

texts.en:
“Dimpu Hotel” was a tea stall at the centre of the Saikul market and is what Veineineng, who is the featured member with the raised hand of New-Saikul Group, is well known for. Her tea stall did not accommodate a number of customers, so she took orders and served her customers by taking the tea and the toast/puri to their respective stalls/shops. Most of her customers are shop owners and vegetable vendors. Thus, these catering services are necessary for Veineineng's business success.

Because of her success, Veineineng bought a bench for her tea stall where she could accommodate her customers.  But her dream was shattered when her tea stall was demolished by the government in order to construct a new market shed. Starting all over again with a new tea stall would require a rented shop, for which she needed a security deposit. So, Veineineng considered taking up poultry because she had raised a few chickens before in her yard. She used to raise pigs as well.

This Kiva loan will support her plan and hopefully it will be accomplished. She feels the urge to run a poultry farm because Veineineng believes that she can do well in poultry and expand her business. By availing a loan, she will fulfill her purpose by purchasing more chicks and starting a poultry farm.
 
The other members of the group are engaged in weaving, selling used clothes, running a piggery, and running a paan-dukan. They are cheerful while sharing their experiences and hopeful that WSDS will continue to be a guardian angel in the days to come.

loans.use: To buy chicks and feed to start a new poultry farm.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a 45-year-old married man with six children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He grows cocoa, and with the proceeds he has been able to build a house and pay school fees for his children. He sells the cocoa directly to the factory and is thus assured of a market. Being the good father that he is, Moses desires to educate his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification, despite inadequate capital. Moses is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Yonasan

texts.en: Yonasan is a hardworking, 30-year-old man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a retail shop, and he started the business after dropping out of school. He worked as a casual laborer, and after saving enough money he started his current business. Price fluctuations and high rental fees pose challenges to the growth of his business. His dream is to own a wholesale shop. Yonasan intends to use the loan to buy merchandise such as salt and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as salt and soap to sell

loans.name: Laimanai Lup Group

texts.en:
The featured member with her hand raised is Premita and she belongs to Laimanai Lup. All the group members live together in the same vicinity.  Premita says she has always been interested in tailoring since childhood. She used to tailor before her marriage and continued after she married. She sews mosquito nets, bed sheets, and cushion covers. She stitches these items because they are more profitable and take less time. She says that these items are in high demand at the market and have no risk of expiration.

Demand for Premita’s tailored items is high during holidays, which in Manipur fall in the months of March, October, November and December.  They are used as gift items on occasions like weddings, childbirths, send-off ceremonies, Ningol Chakkouba (Daughters' home visit day) and house-warmings.
 
She cannot supply all the demands of her customers because she is not able to get enough cloth materials due to a shortage of money. She is poignant about this and hopeful to come into a solution in the future.

With this Kiva loan, Premita will contact the cloth retailer, deposit a security, and purchase plenty of supplies for tailoring. Her future plan is to get two or more sewing machines and hire an additional tailor for more productivity. 

The other group members are engaged in wood businesses and jewelry businesses. All the group members are positive and hopeful that affiliations with KIVA will be beneficial.

loans.use: To purchase extra sewing machines and cloth supplies for tailoring.

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en: Eddy runs a small stall where he sells snacks, drinks, cell phone accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. He is an entrepreneur with four persons living in his house. He joined Ruma with only $10 capital to do transactions about 10 months ago and still feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicingng bill payments for the customers. For the last three months,  he has around $ 2 - 25/day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, he needs more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Afiwa est une femme âgée de cinquante-deux ans. Elle est mariée à un infirmier. La cliente travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1995. Elle exerce comme activité la vente des produits d’alimentations générales pour ses clients à sa maison.
