Elle a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d'améliorer le commerce(en achetant plus de marchandises). Avec ses profits supplémentaires, elle voudrait acheter un terrain. Dans les prochaines années, Afiwa voudrait achever l`avancement et la récréation d'autres boutiques. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit une condition de vie améliorée.
texts.en:
Afiwa is a 52-year-old woman, married to a male nurse.  She has been working as a reseller since 1995, selling basic food supplies to her customers, from home.

She has requested a third loan from WAGES in order to improve her commercial activity and buy more goods.

Afiwa would like to use her additional profits to buy a plot of land.  In the coming years, she would like to open and develop other shops.  She says that with her profits, she is expecting her living conditions to improve.

loans.use: to buy basic food supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the costs of preparing his barber shop

loans.name: Hannington

texts.en: Hannington is a 43-year-old married man with with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Thirteen years ago he decided to venture into agriculture. Like most farmers, he is challenged by seasonal weather changes, especially prolonged drought. His dream is to progress into modern farming activities. He is determined to change his future and that of his children by educating them up to the University, and his prayer is that they graduate and work for reputable institutions. Hannington intends to use this loan to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Anani

texts.fr: Anani est un homme âgé de 39 ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse. Il a deux enfants de 15 et 12ans qui vont à l’école. Anani travaille comme projectionniste depuis 2011. Il projette des matchs de football et les enfants viennent aussi jouer aux jeux. Anani a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter un projecteur. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité. Dans les prochaines années, Anani voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité et assurer le bien être de la famille.
texts.en:
Anani is a 39-year-old man, married to a reseller.  He has two children, aged 15 and 12, who both go to school.  

Anani has been working as a projectionist since 2011.  He projects soccer games, and children also come to play (video) games.

He has requested a third loan from WAGES in order to buy a projector.  He wants to reinvest in his business.  In the coming years, he would like to expand his activity and ensure the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy a projector.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the costs of improving the family home

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.ru:
Руслан занимается выращиванием овощей в теплицах на своем участке в с Водяное уже 6 лет. Живет с женой и двумя детьми в своем доме. В основном выращивает помидоры, огурцы, редис. Руслан - трудолюбивый, у него современные теплицы, есть наемные работники. Последние несколько лет всю прибыл он вкладывал в развитие бизнеса. В следующем году хочет построить дом для своей семьи. Руслан просит предоставить ему кредит для закупки угля для отопления теплиц.

Примечание: на фото Руслан вместе со своей женой.
texts.en:
Ruslan lives in Vodyanoye and he grows vegetables in greenhouses, on his own piece of land.  He has been involved in this activity for six years already.  He lives with his wife and two children in his own house.

Ruslan essentially grows tomatoes, cucumbers and radishes.  He is a hardworking man who owns modern greenhouses and hires laborers.  In the past years, he invested all his profits into the development of his business.  Next year he wants to build a house for his family.

He is requesting this loan for the purchase of coal, to heat his greenhouses.

Note:  The other person in the photo is Ruslan's wife.

loans.use: to buy coal to heat his greenhouses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy grocery stock e.g. fruits, maize, beans, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married business lady. She owns a retail shop--a business which she has been running for almost two years. She sells foodstuffs, household goods, etc.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group, and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is a lack of having adequate money for a business expansion--a problem she sees partly sorted with this loan. 

Naomi is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya Shillings to buy soft drinks, maize, beans, rice and cooking fat. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve on the living standards of her family. She aspires to own a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, maize, beans, rice and cooking fat

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of seven children, six of whom are in school. She runs a cafe, which has been in operation for eight years. She also has a transport business, running a three-wheeler. Francisca employs nine other people in her business.

Francisca was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 41,900 Kenya Shillings to buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals, etc.

Despite the challenge of power outages, Francisca believes she can save the extra income for the education of her children, provide a means of income to the other employees, and also use part of the money to open a restaurant.

loans.use: To buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals etc.

loans.name: Rebeccah

texts.en:
Rebeccah is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of three school children. She runs a clothing shop that has been operating for three years. She also runs a grocery stall beside her clothing business. 
 
Rebeccah was introduced to Milango by her friends and joined to access credit. She is applying for a loan of 85,900 Kenyan shillings to purchase new clothes (e.g., shoes, trousers, shirts) and handbags to sell.

Rebeccah believes that the income from this loan will help her to educate her children. She is focused on her goal of owning a wholesale shop despite the challenges of high stocking costs and transporting the goods from suppliers.  Operating a wholesale shop would likely make most of her items beyond the public's reach. She looks forward to establishing a larger boutique.

loans.use: to purchase new clothes (e.g., shoes, trousers, shirts) and handbags to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy welding bars, plates, and rods.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin lives in the Kongowea area of Coast province. He is married and has two children. 

Franklin owns a carpentry workshop, which he has been operating for 7 years now. He started the business using his savings. Franklin learnt about Milango through friends with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business. The challenge he is facing is purchasing stock. 

Franklin is applying for a loan of 41,850 KES to buy timber, nails, and other equipment for the workshop. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to repair the broken machines and service them and also provide for his family’s basic needs. 

His future plans are to expand the business to own a larger outlet.

loans.use: to buy timber, nails, and other equipment for the workshop.

loans.name: Kamleh

texts.en:
Kamleh is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo. He is pictured next to the vegetable cart. 

Kamleh is a married woman from Tulkarem city. She is a mother to three sons and two daughters. Kamleh works on a small fruits and vegetables cart  and her husband is a worker but they would like to improve the family income by buying more seasonal fruits and vegetables to resell. 

Kamleh is requesting a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help the family to improve their income by buying more fruits and vegetables to sell again.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Waleed

texts.en: Waleed is a 18 year old young man. He is a university student and wants to complete his studies. He is requesting a 600 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of his new laptop, which he is pictured with. The laptop will help Waleed with homework, reports, and his studies generally. The laptop will ensure that Waleed has a better future and improves the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new clothes for sale, like handbags, shoes, trousers and shirts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries like vegetables, cereals, rice and cooking fat.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. He is the married father of two school-going children. Julius runs a primary school as an investment and began this out of the desire to provide affordable education to the children in the vicinity. He employs six teachers in the school. The school has been running for five years.

Julius was introduced to Milango by an employee and is applying for a loan of 21,100 KES to repair damaged desks.

Julius looks forward to offering boarding facilities in the future.

loans.use: to repair damaged desks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items for her retail shop, such as toothpaste and toys.

loans.name: Kenanga Indah Group

texts.en:
The Kenanga Indah Group needs a new loan with increasing size to continue business and to cover the price of feed.  The loans will be used to purchase super quality piglets and feed.

Ni Komang uses her loans to purchase 3 superior piglets and uses the rest for feed.  To reduce the cost of feed, she gives the piglets a traditional feed made from banana leaf.  She hopes the price will be high again because it is already nearing the holiday for Hindusm.

loans.use: to purchase 3 piglets and feed.

loans.name: Sari Madu Group

texts.en:
Ni Luh is a 25-year-old housewife with a 3-year-old toddler.  She has run the business since she has been married.  As the head of the Sari Madu group, Ni Luh and members received their fourth loans at 1,5M IDR each.

To increase business, Ni Luh will use the loan to purchase 2 superior piglets and super quality feed.  Ni Luh hopes MUK will still support their business until they can have enough capital to run the business by themselves.

loans.use: to purchase 2 superior piglets and super quality feed.

loans.name: Sait

texts.en: Sait runs a small stall where he sells snacks, drinks, cell phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime credits. He is an entrepreneur who has five persons living in his house. He joined Ruma three months ago because he wanted to increase his income and he is still really excited to expand his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for his customers. For the last three months, he has around $ 25 - 40/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he needs more working capital loan in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To obtain more float to process payments on weekends

loans.name: Bernardito

texts.en:
Bernardito is a 60-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol.  He earns a living for several years through his tricycle transport business.  Bernardito is asking for a loan in order to pay the remaining balance of his tricycle. 

In the future, Bernardito hopes to make his business a success.  Moreover, he plans to save money for future use and to repay his loan.

loans.use: to pay the remaining balance of his tricycle.

loans.name: Mulyadi

texts.en: Mulyadi runs a small stall where he sells cell phone accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. He is an entrepreneur who has three persons living in his house. He joined Ruma a month ago because he wanted to increase his income and he is still really excited to expand his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for his customers. For the last months, he has around $130 - 170/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, he needs more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To obtain more float to process mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Yayan

texts.en: Yayan runs a small stall where he sells snacks, drinks, groceries, and mobile phone airtime credits. Recently, he worked as a fabric laborer. He has four persons living in his house. He joined Ruma seven months ago because he wanted to increase his income and he still feels really excited to expand his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for his customers. For the last three months, he has around $55 - 80/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, he needs a loan for more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To obtain more float to process mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Talibon, Bohol. She is a farmer and has been in the farming business for more than 20 years now. Pedrita works hard to support her husband in improving and tilling their land.

Pedrita is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to improve the productivity of the farm and its yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Teratai Indah Group

texts.en:
The Teratai Indah Group received their new loan. One member could not attend the meeting because she had a religious ceremony at the temple. With the same loan amount, they will use the new loan to grow their businesses.

Sayu Komang will use her loan to purchase 3 superior piglets as well as feed. She hopes she can sell them at a higher price so she can save money and meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase 3 superior piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Dewi Fortuna Group

texts.en: After a successful repayment of the last loans, Dewi Fortuna Group proceeds to the next loan period with a purpose of improving their businesses. Jero Pudak, head of the group, coordinates the purchase of piglets and ensures that all members get good piglets. With the loan, she will buy three piglets of a local species for pork rolls that are sold every 2 months. With the income from this effort, she hopes to buy floors for her home, which are still concrete. One member resigned and only 9 people are left in the group.

loans.use: to purchase three piglets of a local species.

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.en:
Reynalda is a 68-year-old farmer from Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of six grown up children. Reynalda has been engaged in farming together with her husband for more than 30 years. This is the source of their income.

Reynalda is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. She believes that this loan could help her in improving their farm and its harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Hoeun

texts.en:
Hoeun is 61 years old. She is married and resides with eight children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in animal husbandry for more than 10 years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband is a farmer and fisherman. He makes an income of $3 each day. Five of her children are employed; they earn about $18 per day. 

Due to lack of funds, Hoeun requests a loan of $1,300 to purchase construction materials to build a new house. This money will help her obtain a comfortable house and provide better living conditions for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and help her children earn higher education.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a new house.

loans.name: Srikandi 2 Group

texts.en:
Ni Wayan and the members of Srikandi 2 group received their second loan. After evaluating the last loan, the group received an increased loan size. They will use the loan to purchase superior piglets and feed.

Ni Wayan will use her loan to purchase four superior piglets; she bought feed with her money. She will manage the pigs for fattening, and she hopes the growth of the pigs will be maximized so she can earn a satisfactory profit.

loans.use: To purchase four superior piglets.

loans.name: Srikandi 1 Group

texts.en:
The Srikandi 1 Group is a female group and has nine members. The group is located in Baturiti, at the centre of Bali. The group consists of nine women who are all pig breeders. Although they already have main jobs, they run this business to supplement their family income. Most of them work in a garden as a farmer.

Ni Made, the head of the group, coordinated for the group to receive a loan and training from MUK. They need the loan to keep the business running and for training to improve their knowledge of pig breeding. Ni Made will use the loan to purchase 4 local pigs for pig rolls. She has a plan to save the profit to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase four local pigs.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario is 56 years old and married with three children. He lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He owns and operates a motorcycle-transport business in the local community to earn a living. He has been with his business for over four years and earns 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

He joined GDMPC in the year 2011, and now he has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase spare parts. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Rommel

texts.en:
Rommel is 34 years old and a farmer from Amulung. He plants and harvests rice to sell as the source of his income. He also pays laborers who help him plant and harvest rice to sell. He has been in his business for over 10 years now. 

Rommel is now asking for additional capital of 12,000  PHP (Philippines pesos) to invest in his farmland and achieve a profitable harvest. He will buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. This will help improve the growth of his crops. 

In the future, Rommel hopes to keep improving his crop production and income to lift his family from poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming.

loans.name: Sam Ang

texts.en:
Sam Ang is 44 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than two years, earning approximately $10 daily. Her husband is a truck driver who makes an income of $7 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Sam Ang requests a loan of $800 to purchase more goods for resale. This purchase will help her increase stock and generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand the business and help her child earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she wants to rebuild her house to make it much better.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for resale.

loans.name: Zema

texts.en:
Zema is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of three young children from Talibon, Bohol. She earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business. She has been in this venture for more than five years now. 

Zema is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, rice, sugar, biscuits and chips, soda, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

In the future, Zema has hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, rice, sugar, biscuits and chips, soda, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Yeyen

texts.en:
Yeyen is 63 years old and married. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She raises pigs for sale to earn a living. She has been with her business for over nine years and earns 8,000  PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She joined GDMCP in the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase feeds for the pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Bawi Lestari 1 Group

texts.en:
Bawi Lestari 1 group is receiving a second loan from MUK. With membership made up of seven people, the total loan is 24.5M IDR (Indonesian rupiah). The loan will be used to buy piglets and feed and to repair cages.

Ni Nengah, as the head of the group, is using the loan to buy three piglets. The price for the superior pig species is currently very expensive, ranging from 400,000–500,000 IDR. These pigs will be maintained for five months for fattening. Ni Nengah expects during the loan period, the pig will be able to develop properly, without being attacked by disease. With this effort, she has a dream to fix her house.

loans.use: To buy three piglets.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en: Francisco is 62-years-old and married with four children. He lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He operates a service of recycling native leaves to make baskets, mats, etc. to earn a living. He has been with this business for over eight years and earns PHP 5,000 to purchase raw materials. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to recycle into baskets and mats.

loans.name: Bawi Lestari 2 Group

texts.en: Ni Nyoman is successfully maintaining her pigs; her husband supports her business because the result can help improve the family's income. She also successfully renovated the barn. Now, she needs a new loan to purchase superior piglets. Her husband gives her money to support the business and purchase a sow. She hopes the sow will give her healthy piglets that she can sell to other breeders in her village.

loans.use: To purchase superior piglets.

loans.name: Sam Ben

texts.en: Sam Ben is 49 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been making traditional items to sell for more than ten years earning approximately $20 daily. Her husband helps her run the business. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sam Ben requests a loan of $1,000 to purchase farmland. This purchase will generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand the business and help her youngest child earn bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase farmland.

loans.name: Honeylyn

texts.en: Honelyn is 32-years-old and a single mom with two children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She owns and manages a service of recycling and makes baskets, mat, etc. to earn a living. She has been with her business for over three years and earns PHP 3,000 every month. She has joined  GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase raw materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en: Danilo is 55-years-old, married and blessed with four children. They are residing in the village of Marabulig 1. He owns and operates a transportation business for almost five years and is earning a net income of PHP 3,000 a month. He would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted to improve his business.

loans.use: To pay for the repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Carlito

texts.en:
Carlito is a farmer from Amulung. He is 41 years old, married and has a child who is in elementary education. He plants and harvests rice to sell. From his farming business, he usually makes about 15,000 PHP each harvest season, which is twice a year. He uses it for meals and to support his child. He is now asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming. 

Growing healthy crops will help him achieve abundant harvest and make more profits, which is necessary in supporting his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Le Chandelier 1 Group

texts.en:
Nathalie, age 40, is single with three children, aged between 3 and 12 years old. All three children are currently attending school. She is representing the Le Chandelier 1 group. Nathalie primarily sells a variety of drinks, but she also has some beignets and small cakes for sale. She has had this business for four years. She will use the loan to buy imported boxed wine. Her business strategy is to provide great customer service to her clients. She also doesn't let the merchandise get low. She keeps her shelves stocked with what her customers want. 
This is Nathalie's first loan with HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. HOPE and her group are confident she will be able to pay back the loan. She would like to open a bakery in the future. She hopes her children will finish school and be able to find fulfilling work.

loans.use: to pay for imported boxed wine.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is a 48 year old married woman and a mother of children. They live in Talibon, Bohol. Felicitas operates a sari-sari, or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her area.
Felicitas is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell such as canned goods, rice, sugar, chips, biscuits, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers in her store, thus increasing her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, rice, sugar, chips, biscuits, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Forster

texts.en:
Forster is a 47-year-old trader who sells cereals. He is married to Patience, a 42-year-old trader. They have three children. He resides in Dansoman. This has been his business for two years. 
 
He is very time-conscious, hardworking and customer-friendly. Also he keeps smiling even when you say something bad about him and he is ready to learn. 

This is his fourth loan from ID Ghana and he needs an amount of GHC 1,500 to buy more goods for his business and to satisfy his customers.

loans.use: to buy more cereals for resale

loans.name: Donatille

texts.en:
Donatille is a 45-year-old woman from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. She is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.

Donatille started selling lights in July 2012 and she has sold 40 lights to date, providing clean energy to 200 people. She is also a farmer and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business.

loans.use: to pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity

loans.name: Theresie

texts.en:
Theresie is a 38-year-old woman from the Rulindo district in the Northern Province of Rwanda. She is seeking a loan of 50 USD to purchase ten rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just 0.20 USD. 

Theresie started selling lights in August of 2012, and she has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. She is also a farmer and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself, her husband Gaspard and their four children.

loans.use: to pay for low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Tineere Group

texts.fr:
Mme CLEMENTINE est responsable du groupe TINEERE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de deux (02) enfants. Le plus âgé a 05ans et le moins âgés à 03 ans. Les 02 vont à l’école (la maternelle) et  elle a 04 personnes en charge. 
Mme fait la restauration depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes. 
Elle veut s’acheter 03 sacs de riz et 01 sac de grain d’arachide. 
Elle veut mieux s’occuper de sa famille avec ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne toujours ouvrir un restaurant et s’acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Clementine is the leader of the Tineere group. She is doing well. Married, she is a mother of two children. The oldest is five years old and the youngest is three years old. They both go to nursery school. And she has four people under her care.

Clementine has been preparing and serving food for four years. She procures her goods from a market in her area. Her customers are both men and women. 

She wants to buy three sacs of rice and a sac of groundnut flour. With her earnings, she would like to take better care of her family. Clementine hopes to one day open a restaurant and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy three sacs of rice and a sac of groundnut flour

loans.name: Karibu Group

texts.fr: Cimwemwesa est vice présidente du groupe Karibu, jeune entrepreneur, âgée de 26 ans et mère de 2 enfants. Son conjoint est un petit commerçant.  La cliente est une enseignante. En plus, elle est aussi vendeuse d’huile de palme. Elle commença avec un fonds reçu d’un membre de sa famille. Ainsi, ce nouveau crédit va lui servir d’acheter 2 bidons d’huile. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien financier. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bebes.
texts.en:
Cimwemwesa is the vice-president of the Karibu group. She is a young, 26-year-old entrepreuneur and the mother of 2 children. Her spouse is a small retailer and she is a teacher. She also sells palm oil. She started her business with funds she received from a family member. This new loan will allow her to buy 2 cans of oil. She would like to thank Hekima for its financial support.

Note: some customers are holding their babies in the picture.

loans.use: to buy 2 cans of oil.

loans.name: La Paix Virunga Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kabuo est secrétaire du groupe La paix Virunga, entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 42 ans,  mariée et mère de 8 enfants, qui étudient tous. Il s’entraide avec son conjoint dans le petit commerce. La cliente est commerçante de denrées alimentaires. Elle commença avec son fonds propre. Il ya plus de 20 ans, elle fait cette affaire. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter les divers produits (oignons, tomates, ails, farines, haricots, pommes de terre, etc.). Elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien financier.Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bebe.
texts.en:
Kabuo is the secretary of the group "La Paix Virunga".  She is 42 years old and a dynamic entrepreneur.  She is also married and the mother of eight children who all attend school.  

Kabuo and her husband help each other to run a small retail business.  Kabuo sells food products.  She started in this business more than 20 years ago, using her own funds.

She will use this new loan to buy various products (onions, tomatoes, garlic, flour, beans, potatoes etc.)  

Kabuo wants to see her children go to school.  In the end, she thanks Hekima for its financial support.

It should be noted that, in the photo, one of the borrowers is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to buy various goods (onions, tomatoes, garlic, flour, beans, potatoes etc.)

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is 45 years old and married with four children. She lives in Kisauni, Kenya with her four children and husband. All her children are in school; therefore, school fees payment is a major monthly expenditure. 

Mariamu owns and operates a grocery stall, which she has been operating for the past four years. She has gained a wide experience, thanks to her way of relating to her worthy customers. 

She has approached for her loan request of KES 25,000 to buy sacks of potatoes and onions to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes and onions to boost her business.

loans.name: Mumo

texts.en:
Mumo is a 45-year-old businessman living in Samburu, Kenya. He is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. He lives in a rental house which has electricity and tap water. He is an entrepreneur who buys and sells goats, a business he has been running for the last four years.

He has requested a loan of KES 25,000 to buy goats to resell. He is grateful for help.

loans.use: to buy goats to resell.

loans.name: Waseem Rafique

texts.en:
Waseem Rafique is 47 years old. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. Since 2000, he has been running a fabric business;  it is the only source of income for the family. 

Presently he is interested in purchasing more fabric for his shop, but the lack of money makes it difficult. Therefore, he has requested a loan of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. This will help him offer a wider variety to his customers. 

Waseem Rafique is facing a few challenges in his business because today, people prefer to purchase ready-made clothes instead of fabric to make clothing; this trend is negative for his business. 

He wishes to get great progress as a result of the loan. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase cloth for his business.

loans.name: Naftal

texts.en:
Naftal lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya.  He is married and has one school-going child. He owns a security firm, providing daytime and nighttime guard services. The business has been in operation for six years, and he employs over 100 employees in his firm. He also owns a bar. 

Naftal learned about Milango through advertisements, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is a lack of capital, a problem he could partly address with this loan.

Naftal is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to buy security uniforms. He believes that the business has improved enough to allow him to make the required repayments for the loan despite high competition.

loans.use: To buy security uniforms.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en: Dama is a vegetable vendor in her village. Most days, she earns an income of Kshs. 200 that she uses to meet the immediate needs of her family. She wants to improve her business and that is why she is requesting a loan of Kshs 30,000. She will use the money to improve her small enterprise and expand it so that she can earn a higher income to better provide for the needs of her family. She is thankful that her six children are very responsible and helpful, despite their poor living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in her business of selling vegetables.

loans.name: Duterimbere/gituza Group

texts.fr:
Jean Marie est membre du groupe DUTERIMBERE/GITUZA, il est marie avec 4 enfants de 11 ans et le moins agé a 6 ans  et est agé de 40 ans. il a étudie 6 eme primaire. il veut ce crédit pour acheter les angrais chimiques dont 50 kg de NPK, médicament agricole intitulé BENERATE de 5 litre et préparer le champs.

Il n`attend aucun difficulte pour le remboursement. ses strategie est d`accroitre son projet en ameliorant le systeme à cultiver. ses ambitions est d`accroitre son projet et pour sa famille c`est de scolariser et soigner sa famille.
texts.en:
Jean Marie is a member of the group DUTERIMBERE/GITUZA. He is a 40-year-old married father to four children aged 6 to 11. He attended six years of primary school. 

He is seeking this loan to purchase chemical fertilizers, namely 50 kgs of NPK and five liters of a farming medicine called BENERATE to help prepare the fields. He does not anticipate any problems with loan repayment. 

His business growth strategy is to expand his activity by improving the farming process. His goals are to expand his business and to provide for his family’s healthcare and education.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tea tree seedlings for her business.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 24-year-old single man. He lives alone in a small house in Rafah city.

For the past three years, Khaled has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to him.

Khaled is requesting a $1,500 USD loan from FATEN to cover the insurance policy and licensing expenses for the taxi he drives. This will help him to cover some of the expenses he has now.

Khaled appears in the photo beside his taxi.

loans.use: to pay the insurance policy and licensing  expenses for his taxi.

loans.name: Aftar's Group

texts.en:
Aftar is a 29-year-old Iraqi woman.  She is married and the mother of two children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Aftar is one of the many Iraqi women who are working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

She has five years of experience with small, home-based sewing and tailoring work, making dresses for women and children as well as household items based on orders by her customers.  She would like to improve her work and increase the type of services as well as the level of creativity in her work in order to be able to offer a greater variety of options to her customers.  She would like to buy an overlock machine and nice, good quality fabrics and raw materials.  To pay for these purchases, she took a loan from Relief International-Microfinance Iraq.  

Relief International-Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor and who are thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan.  Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity.  All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine and nice, good quality fabrics and raw materials.

loans.name: Nashwa

texts.en: Nashwa is a 24-year-old single lady. She is the youngest of 4 children. Mashwa is a university student majoring in Managerial Information Systems. She is now applying for an educational loan to pay for her current semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her current semester fees.

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a single Iraqi youth client. He is 24 years old and lives with his parents and his brother, all of whom provide the income of the family together.

Raed owns a small shop for selling mobile phones and accessories. After working for many years in several mobile shops, Raed, after gaining good fame and experience, finally decided to open his own shop in 2011 and hired an employee. 

He is requesting sum of $1,800 USD for a youth loan to renovate his shop and to increase his mobile inventory.

Raed is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide himself with better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and to increase his mobile inventory.

loans.name: Iqra

texts.en: Iqra is a 22-year-old hardworking lady doing business sewing. She has been in this line of work for 6 years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income.  When Iqra was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her sewing skills in a productive manner. Due to limited resources none of her two brothers were sent to school. Iqra felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. She has established a good clientele but she is having difficulty in fulfilling large orders. That’s when her sister advised her to borrow from Kashf Foundation. She requested for a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase more spools of thread and packs of needles. In this she would be able to cater to more customers time after time which ultimately helps in generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread and packs of needles.

loans.name: Baker

texts.en:
Baker is a married youth client from Iraq. He is 20 years old and has a child. 

He owns a small shop and specializes in repairing tires and changing engine oils for various types of vehicles. He started working in this field in 2010, and after gaining sufficient experience, he chose this field as a career path. Baker is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Baker is requesting a sum of $2,400 USD for a youth loan to buy equipment specialized for his work and a motor generator. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide his child a good education and a promising future.

loans.use: to buy equipment specialized for his work and a motor generator

loans.name: Rosa Jannet

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer der 40 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora  y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a sus hijos, ya que ella es madre y padre par ellos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven, Rosa no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Enfermería que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con sus hijos y en algunas ocasiones les cocina una riquísima Carapulcra para engreírlos.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Rosa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de golosinas, ella realiza sus ventas de manera ambulatoria y puede trabajar por un aproximado de 12 horas, ella cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de la matrícula del colegio de sus hijos, así también podrá comprar los útiles escolares de sus pequeños, de esta manera ellos podrán contar con los materiales necesarios para cursar adecuadamente sus estudios, así pues Rosa seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ver a sus hijos convertidos en buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 40-year-old woman who lives with her children in the city of Ica. She loves her children and they are her main reason for living. Rosa is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who dedicates all of her efforts toward helping her children move forward. She must play the roles of both mother and father. Unfortunately, due to the lack of financial resources and the need to work at a very young age, Rosa was not able to study for a nursing degree as she had hoped. In her free time, she enjoys playing with her children and on some occasions she will prepare a delicious dish of “carapulcra” (a spicy Peruvian stew) as a treat for them.

Through her own initiative and with great effort and dedication, Rosa works at her small business of selling snack foods. Her sales are conducted as a street vendor and she is able to work approximately 12 hours. She believes that she is doing well because of the friendly service that she offers to her customers.

Rosa is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, she will be able to cover the cost of school tuition for her children. She will also be able to buy school supplies for them so that they will have the necessary materials to adequately continue with their studies. Rosa continues to work and strive toward achieving her greatest wish of seeing her children become successful professionals.

loans.use: to pay for her children's school expenses.

loans.name: Escarlin

texts.es: La Sra. Escarlin  tiene 38 años tiene un hijo de la edad de 10 años, el se dedica  a la fabricación de  sombreros de sao lo realiza con  una planta ella utiliza sus tallos, realiza esta actividad desde hace ya varios años actividad que aprendió de su padre,  ella vive en la localidad de Paurito,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Escarlin  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una heladera para su uso personal ya que esta le permitirá refrescar sus alimentos, La Sra. Escarlin  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida, su deseo es vender sus productos artesanales a distintas localidades y también a la ciudad de Santa cruz y  ser una de las mejores artesanas, se siente feliz  y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en:
Sra. Escarlin is 38 years old and has a 10-year-old son. She makes straw hats from the stems of a particular plant. Escarlin has been in this business for several years since she learned the trade from her father. She lives in the town of Paurito.

This is her first loan cycle with Emprender. Sra. Escarlin will use the loan to buy a refrigerator for personal use. This will allow her to keep her food cold. Sra. Escarlin faces challenges in her business as she seeks to rise above poverty. She will utilize the benefits of this loan in order to improve her quality of life. Her wish is to sell her handmade products in different towns and also in the city of Santa Cruz. She also wants to become one of the best artisans.

Escarlin is pleased and appreciative of the support that Emprender has provided.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Adjo est une jeune dame de 35ans. Son conjoint travaille dans un hôtel et elle a un enfant de 11ans scolarisé. Afin de prêter main forte à son conjoint, elle vend du gravier depuis 2010. Elle est aidée par 02 personnes et sollicite son premier crédit pour achat de gravier. Elle veut augmenter la taille de son entreprise et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille.
texts.en: Adjo is a young, 35-year-old woman. Her spouse works in a hotel and she has an 11-year-old child who attends school. She has been selling gravel since 2010 in order to be able to support her spouse. She has help from 2 people and is requesting her first loan so that she can buy gravel. She would like to increase the size of her business and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy gravel.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Kodjo est un homme de 56ans.  Il a 10 enfants dont 06 sur les bancs d’école. Il exerce son activité de jardinier avec sa femme dans une localité de la ville de Lomé et sont par moment aidés par leurs enfants. Afin d’acheter des engrais et des graines de semence pour sa récolte, Kodjo sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour s’en procurer. Comme perspectives d‘avenir, il souhaite avoir d’autres jardins et avoir une bonne condition de vie.
texts.en: Kodjo is a 56-year-old man. He has 10 children, 6 of whom are attending school. He runs his gardening business with his wife in a neighbourhood of Lomé town, and they are currently helped by their children. Kodjo is requesting his first loan from WAGES in order to buy fertilizer and seed grain for his crop. His future ambitions include owning more plots of land and having a good standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed grain.

loans.name: Aouh

texts.fr: Aouh est une femme de 44ans. Il a  pour homme un carreaulleur  et est mère d’un enfant de 20ans qui va à l’école. Afin d’aider son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, elle a démarré la vente des chaussures et des liqueurs. Cela depuis 03ans et elle s’approvisionne généralement au Grand marché de Lomé. Pour pouvoir agrandir son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille, elle fait son premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Le profit réalisé lui servira d’atteindre ses objectifs.
texts.en: Aouh is a 44-year-old woman. Her husband is a tiler and she is the mother of a 20-year-old who goes to school. She started a business selling shoes and liqueurs in order to be able to support her husband with the household expenses. She has been doing this for 3 years and normally gets her supplies at the Lomé Grand Market. In order to be able to increase her business and improve her family's living conditions, she is requesting her first loan from WAGES with which to buy merchandise. She will use the profits she makes to reach her goals.

loans.use: to buy shoes and liqueurs.

loans.name: Valor Y Sacrificio Group

texts.es: La Sra. Doris de 45 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos los cuales aún dependen de ella. Lleva 5 años como cliente de Edaprospo y se dedica al servicio de costura desde hace más de 3 años. Comenzó por medio de la motivación de sus hijos, quienes la incentivaron a que ponga su propio taller de costura y trabaje como una persona independiente. También se dedica a la artesanía desde hace 15 años aproximadamente. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo, Doris ha logrado construir su casa y estabilizarse económicamente. Actualmente ella cubre los gastos de alimentación, mientras que sus hijos la ayudan con los gastos de agua y luz. Su plan para el futuro es ampliar su taller de confección y abrir una tienda de ropa en su domicilio. Ella usó el crédito en la compra de una maquina remalladora para continuar con su servicio de costura. Doris pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Valor y Sacrificio”, el cual está conformado por 6 personas y lleva el cargo de presidenta desde hace 4 meses, ella es la persona que se encuentra de pie en el grupo.
texts.en: Doris is 45 years old.  She is single and has two children, both of whom are still dependent on her.  She has been a customer with Edaprospo for five years and she has been making a living as a seamstress for more than three years.  She started the work because of her children, who encouraged her to open her own sewing workshop and work independently.  Doris has also been making artisan crafts for around 15 years.  With effort and hard-work, Doris has managed to build a house to become financially stable.  She is currently covering food costs while her children help with the water and electricity bills.  Doris' plan for the future is to expand her workshop and open a clothes shop in her home.  She will use the loan to buy an overlock sewing machine to continue with her sewing work.  Doris is a member of the "Valor y Sacrificio" communal bank, which has six members.  Doris has been the group's president for four months.  In the photo, Doris is the group member that is standing up.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille et mieux répondre aux besoins des clients, Akouvi exerce comme activité la vente des ustensiles de cuisine dans une boutique. Elle est couturière de profession et revendeuse en même temps.  Notons qu’elle est mariée et a 04 enfants en charge. Trois de ces derniers sont scolarisés, l’ainé a 28ans et le dernier 12ans.
texts.en: Akouvi sells kitchen utensils in a shop in order to improve her family's living conditions and better respond to her customers' needs. She is a dressmaker by profession and also a retailer. She is married and has 4 dependent children, three of whom go to school. The eldest child is 28 years old and the youngest, 12.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es: María de 24 años de edad, es soltera y se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Contabilidad en la Universidad Peruana de las Américas. La carrera dura 6 años y aún le falta medio año para culminar. Ella trabaja como auxiliar contable en una empresa de Asesoría Contable, generando ingresos el cual lo destina a pagar sus estudios. Ella está muy inspirada y motivada en terminar su carrera, ya que son sus padres quienes le dan la fuerza para poder salir adelante. Uno de sus mayores desafíos es el poder estudiar y trabajar a la misma vez, es por eso que le pone mucho entusiasmo, empeño y dedicación a lo que estudia. Su plan para el futuro es convertirse en una contadora de éxito y en una profesional independiente. El crédito lo usará en el pago de su matrícula y mensualidad de su carrera.
texts.en: María is 24 years old.  She is single and is currently studying Accounting at the "Universidad Peruana de las Américas" university. The degree course lasts six years and María still has six months before she finishes. María works as an assistant in an accounting firm to earn money that she will use to pay her studies.  María is very inspired and motivated to finish her studies as it is her parents who give her the strength to move ahead.  One of María's biggest challenges is studying and working at the same time so she is enthusiastic and puts in a lot of determination and dedication into her education.  Her plan for the future is to become a successful accountant and independent professional.  María will use the loan to pay for her matriculation and monthly tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for her matriculation and monthly tuition fees.

loans.name: Channthy

texts.en:
Channthy is 32 years old. She is married and resides with one child in the Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in garment factory for more than four years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who makes an income of $4 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Channthy requests a loan of $500 to purchase cattle to resell. This purchase will help her make more income for the family. In the future, she would like to purchase more cattle to breed and resell and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to resell.

loans.name: Adjelevi

texts.fr: Madame Adjélévi a 49 ans et est mariée à un électricien. Elle a 1 enfant à charge. Pour participer au ménage, elle fait la vente de bijoux et des habits prêt à porter. Elle a commencé cette activité en 1985 et s’approvisionne au Ghana à Accra et au Bénin à Cotonou. Ensuite elle revend au grand marché de Lomé. Elle sollicite de WAGES un quatrième prêt pour se réapprovisionner. Elle veut assurer la stabilité de son activité et le bien être de la famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adjélévi, age 49, is married to an electrician and has one child to support. To contribute to household expenses, she sells jewelry and ready-to-wear clothing.

She started this business in 1985, and gets her supplies in Accra (Ghana) and Cotonou (Benin). She then resells at the Grand Market in Lomé.

She's seeking a fourth loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to resupply. She wants to ensure the stability of her business and the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.fr: Revendeuse de bijoux au marché, Madame Rosalie exerce cette activité depuis 2005 et s’approvisionne généralement chez les grossistes au BENIN.  Elle sollicite son second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Le profit tiré de la vente lui servira d’agrandir son activité et de mieux s’occuper de sa famille. Elle mère de 03 enfants tous scolarisés âgés de 18,16 et 12ans. Elle partage sa vie avec un menuisier et est âgée de  41ans.
texts.en:
Since 2005, Mrs. Rosalie has been reselling jewelry at the market. She usually gets her supplies from wholesalers in Benin.

She's seeking her second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy supplies and meet customer demand.

Profits earned from the sales will be used to expand her business and take better care of her family.

Mrs. Rosalie is 41 years old and lives with a furniture maker. She's the mother of three children, aged 18, 16, and 12, who all go to school.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Monsieur Kossi vit avec sa femme revendeuse et leurs 02 enfants de 06 et 03ans à LOME. Il chauffeur de profession et sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter un autre taxi (voiture d’occasion) afin de mieux servir les clients de la ville de Lomé. Mr Kossi veut développer son activité en ayant plusieurs voitures et assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Kossi lives with his retailer wife and their 2 children, aged 6 and 3, in Lomé. He is a driver by profession and is requesting his first loan in order to buy another taxi (second hand) so that he can better serve his customers in the town of Lomé. Kossi would like to develop his business by getting more cars and he would like to ensure that his children get an education.

loans.use: to buy a second hand car.

loans.name: Adjisi

texts.fr: Adjisi est une jeune dame de 40ans. Son conjoint est Directeur de société et ils ont 02 enfants tous à l'école. Ils sont âgés de 18 et 15ans. Afin de prêter main forte à son mari dans les charges du foyer, elle revend des pagnes, des bazins et des produits de mercerie à domicile. Activité qu’elle mène depuis 2006 avec deux personnes. Pour mieux répondre aux besoins de ses clients, elle fait un second crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises (pagnes, bazins et mercerie). Le profit tiré de sa vente lui permettra de diversifier sa marchandise pour attirer plus de clientèle et subvenir aux moindres besoins de la famille.
texts.en: Adjisi is a young, 40-year-old woman. Her spouse is a company director and the couple have 2 children, who both go to school. They are 18 and 15 years old. Adjisi sells pagnes (colourful and decorative West African cloth), damask fabric and haberdashery items at home, in order to be able to support her husband with the household expenses. She has been doing this since 2006 with the help of 2 people. In order to better respond to her customers' needs, she is requesting a 2nd loan from WAGES so that she can buy merchandise (pagnes, damask fabric and haberdashery items). The profits generated by her sales will allow her to diversify her product range, so that she can attract more customers and take care of her family's every need.

loans.use: to buy pagnes, damask fabric and haberdashery items.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer and to pay the labourers.

loans.name: Jomalyn

texts.en: Jomalyn is 28 years old and is a single mom of 2 children. She lives in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur and raises pigs to sell in the local community to earn a living. She has been with her business for over 3 years and earns 8,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2011 and now she has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase feed for her pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Remegio

texts.en: Remegio is a 55 year old fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He has been in the fishing business for more than 10 years now. Remegio is asking for a loan to buy materials for the renovation of the house like wood, cement, nails, galvanized iron, etc. In the future, Remegio hopes to expand his fishing business in order to generate more income for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy materials like wood, cement, nails, galvanized iron, etc. for the renovation of his house

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao is 53 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling ice cream for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband runs a business purchasing junk materials to resell. He makes an income of $5 each day. One of her children is a natural medicine vendor who earns about $2 per day. In order to improve her family’s financial situation, Mao requests a loan of $700 to purchase more natural medicine for resale. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand the business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild and maintain her home.

loans.use: to purchase more natural medicines for resale

loans.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio is a 39 year old fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of three children ages 13, 10 and 5.
Sergio is asking for a loan to buy additional fishing nets, floaters, hooks and fuel for his boat. With this, he will be able to improve his chances of a big catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets, floaters, hooks and fuel for his boat

loans.name: Khan

texts.en: Khan is 59 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling palm sugar for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a rice farmer who makes an income of $2 per day. Her children are employed at a garment factory. They earn about $7 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Khan requests a loan of $400 to purchase more palm sugar for resale. This money will help her increase her stock and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand the business and rebuild her house to make it more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase palm sugar for resale

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  femmes du groupe Badenya sont toutes mariées dans des familles monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 46 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Togo dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font le petit commerce de céréales, du charbon de bois et  du bois de chauffe.  Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 9ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Chata  (femme debout en 2ème position sur la photo de la droite vers la gauche) est une grande vendeuse du charbon de bois et de bois de chauffe dans le village de Togo. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 60 sacs de charbon  de bois avec les exploitants du village et environnants de Ségou. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile et dans les quartiers de Ségou en ambulant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et  de femmes. Madame Chata  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer la scolarisation  des enfants du foyer. Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The 4 women of the Badenya group are all married and live in monogamous families. They have an average age of 46 and, on average, 3 children. They all live in the village of Togo in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali) and got to know each other through neighbourly and family relationships, and marriage. They sell cereals, charcoal and firewood. The group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their business, and are on their 9th group loan cycle.

Chata (standing 2nd from the right in the photo) is a larger reseller of charcoal and firewood in the village of Togo. She plans to use her loan to buy 60 bags of charcoal from the farmers in the village and the surrounding area of Ségou. The sales are made for cash or credit door-to-door and on the streets in the districts of Ségou, to a clientèle made up of men and women. Chata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 30 000 francs thanks to this loan, which will be reinvested in her business and used to ensure that the children in the household get an education. Her aim is to increase her sales volume whilst working in partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en: Rodolfo is 43 years old, married and blessed with four children. He has owned and operated a retail store in his village for almost 15 years, earning a net income of 6,000 PHP a month. He would like to avail a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, biscuits and beverages. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted so his business can be more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, biscuits and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Asteria

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Asteria works hard to support her family.

She buys and sells livestock in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Asteria is borrowing 25000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell for her business.

Asteria has been sustaining her business activities through the past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Dembagnouman Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans les  familles polygames, les quatre femmes du groupe Dembagnouman ont en moyenne 49 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Togo dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font le petit commerce de céréales, de calebasses de mortiers et pilons gravés. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 9ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Alimata  (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des calebasses, pilons et mortiers gravés dans leur terroir. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 150 mortiers et 100 pilons. Ils sont ensuite gravés de beaux dessins et slogan à l’aide d’une pince que l’on rougit. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile et dans les quartiers de Ségou en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Alimata  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants du foyer. A l’instar des autres femmes du groupe, Madame Alimata a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Married and mostly living in polygamous families, the 4 women of the Dembagnouman group have an average age of 49 and, on average, 4 children. They all live in the village of Togo in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of Mali) and got to know each other through neighbourly and family relationships, and marriage. They sell cereals, gourds, mortars and engraved pestles. The group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their business, and are on their 9th group loan cycle.

Alimata (standing on the left in the photo) has a great reputation in their region for the sales of gourds, mortars and engraved pestles. She plans to use her loan to buy 150 mortars and 100 pestles. They are then engraved with pretty motifs and slogans using heated pliers. The sales are made for cash or credit, at home and on the streets in the districts of Ségou, to a clientèle made up mainly of women. Alimata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 50 000 francs thanks to this loan, which will be reinvested in her business and used to ensure take care of the children in the household. As with the other members of the group, Alimata's aim is to increase her volume of business whilst working in partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy mortars and pestles.

loans.name: Samphors

texts.en: Samphors is 35 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia.  She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver who makes an income of $7 each day. Because the present motorbike is old, Samphors requests a loan of $1000 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run his taxi service. In addition, a part of this money is used to pay for her house construction. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and help her children earn bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run a taxi service

loans.name: Joseph

texts.fr: joseph est un homme de 43 ans et père de 06 enfants dont il en à l&a charge.pour subvenir au besoin de sa famille,ilo s'est lancé dans la commercialisation des boissons alcoolisées et non alcooliséés dans un quartier de la place depuis près de 06 ans.son commerce évolue bien,mais il voudrait agrandir son activité,et sollicite pour cela un credit chez nous.les bénéfices obtenus permettront à ce client d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et d'étendre si possible son activité.
texts.en: Joseph is a 43-year old man and father to six children, all dependents. In order to provide for his family's needs he began selling alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks in a district of the town almost six years ago. His business is developing well, but he would like to expand it and is thus requesting a loan from us. All the profits he makes will enable this customer to improve his family's living conditions and if possible to build up his business.

loans.use: to increase his stock of drinks, by on average around ten crates of drinks.

loans.name: Jema

texts.en:
Jema lives in Binguang with her husband and their five children. In order to help her husband with the household expenses, she started selling earrings and necklaces as a traveling saleswoman. She's 27 years old, and has been a seller for seven years. 

She gets her supplies in Tuguegarao province of Cagayan. Thanks to the quality of her products, she has several customers in her village, whom she cannot satisfy anymore. She's therefore seeking a first loan from Kiva's parter, WAGES, in order to resupply.

Her future prospects include expanding her business and ensuring her children's future.

loans.use: to buy earrings, necklaces, bracelets and watches for her business

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: Channy is 45 years old. He is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He has been working as a construction worker for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 daily. His wife is a garment worker who makes an income of $4 each day. His children are also employed at garment factories. They earn about $7 per day. Due to lack of funds, Channy requests a loan of $1000 to purchase construction materials to build a new house. This money will help him provide better living conditions for his family. In the future, he would like to run an additional business to make more income to financially support his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a new house

loans.name: Ma Presentacion

texts.es:
Ma presentación es una señora casada que se dedica a la agricultura luchadora y emprendedora de 45 años de edad con una gran familia conformada por 5 hijos los cuales viven en su casa junto a su esposo. Ella tiene un grado de educación cursado hasta el 6 grado de la primaria mismo que pudo hacerlo gracias al apoyo de sus padres quienes con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio lograron que su hija tuviese un conocimiento base. En compañía de su esposo a quien ella considera un gran hombre han logrado echar a andar muchos proyectos de los cuales hoy en día uno de ellos es la cría y venta de gallinas como también la venta de los huevos para generar un poco mas de ingresos a su hogar y poder ayudar a su pareja con la canasta básica. Con la ayuda de sus 2 hijos mayores los cuales estudian y trabajan pero con pocas facilidades no los han podido graduar de una carrera a nivel secundario y el apoyo de su esposo pueden darle juntos mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café. 

Actualmente han emprendido un proyecto el cual conlleva al mejoramiento de su cultivo y están solicitando ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, bombas de fumigación para que esta nueva producción sea mas rentable y mejor aprovechada para su venta.

Sus sueños es lograr graduar a sus hijos para que ellos puedan ser independientes y luchadores y puedan formar su propia micro-empresa la cual les ayude a generar ingresos para sus hogares y puedan cubrir los gastos de sus familias.
texts.en:
Ma Presentación is a plucky and enterprising married woman who makes a living in agriculture.  She has a big family with five children that live at home with her and her husband.  She completed up to sixth grade of primary school thanks to the support of her parents who, with a lot of effort and sacrifices, were able to make sure their daughter could learn the basics.  Alongside her husband, who she believes to be a great man, Ma and her husband have managed many projects one of which is now raising and selling hens and also selling eggs to generate a little bit more income for the household and to help with buying basic necessities.  Their two oldest children are studying and working but with little resources they have not been able to graduate from high school.  With their help and the support of Ma's husband, they work together to look after the coffee plants.

They currently have a project to improve their crops and they are applying for a loan to buy fertilisers, manure and crop-dusting pumps so that the harvest will be more profitable and better for selling.

Ma and her husband's dream is to have their children graduate so that they can become feisty and independent.  They can then start their own micro-business to help them generate more income for their households and they will be able to cover costs in their families.

loans.use: to buy fertlisers, manure and a crop-dusting pump for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Yolande Marlyse

texts.fr: yolande est une femme agée de 38 ans,et mère de 05 enfants.Apres ses études, elle s'est lancée dans la commercialisation du credit de communication dans un quartier de la place.elle sollicite cependant un credit qui va lui permettre d'augmenter son stock de credit et satisfaire davantage sa clientèle.les benefices obtenus serviront à étendre son activité en achetant le materiel servant à la plastification des documents.elle souhaite également aider son époux dans la réalisation de certaines taches.
texts.en: Yolande Marlyse is a 38-year-old woman and the mother of 5 children. After her studies, she started selling prepaid communication cards in a local district. She is requesting a loan to enable her to increase her inventory of prepaid cards so that she can better satisfy her customers. The profits earned will be used to expand her business by buying material with which to laminate documentation. She also hopes to be able to support her husband with the achievement of certain goals.

loans.use: to buy prepaid communication cards.

loans.name: Sinfrosa

texts.en:
Sinfrosa is married and works hard to support her family. She owns a dried fish retail business in the Philippines and has been in this business for nine years.

She is requesting a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy more dried fish for resale.

In the future, Sinfrosa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish for resale

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia lives in the Philippines and is 62 years old. She is married and has two children.

Antonia is a farmer and grows corn and vegetables for a living. She has been doing this for 30 years.

She has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to acquire a parcel of land for farming. 

Antonia has been a member of PMPC for almost six years.

loans.use: to acquire a parcel of land for farming

loans.name: Devorah

texts.en:
Devorah is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a manicure/pedicure business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 23 years. She also earns additional income by selling fish.

Devorah is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase materials such as nail polish, pincers, etc. for her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to be able to afford sending her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as nail polish, pincers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita, age 45, owns and operates a retail store business. She has been engaged in this venture for almost 12 years and currently earns a net income amounting to PhP 4,000 per month. She is a single mother and lives with her son and her mother in the village of Marabulig 1. 

Teresita would like to request a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000, which she will use to purchase noodles, biscuits, coffee, sugar, and beverages to offer for sale. 

Her goal is to have a profitable business so that she can earn more income to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, biscuits, coffee, sugar, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 43 years old and lives in Tamban, Pta. Miray, Baliangao. She is a widow with 2 children. Gemma has a shop that sells assorted grocery items and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan to pay for her child's education. She has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.

loans.use: To pay for her child's tuition fees.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир занимается выращиванием овощей в теплицах в г. Каменка-Днепровская уже 10 лет. Выращивает помидоры, огурцы, редис. Раньше Владимир работал вместе с родителями, потом купил себе дом и начал заниматься огородом самостоятельно. Владимир - трудолюбивый, работает сам, со всем справляется, спокойный, уравновешенный.

В этом году Владимир решил сделать отопление в теплицах. Котел есть, нужно купить трубы и пленку для устройства воздушной подушки. Кроме отопления Владимиру нужно восстановить теплицу для рассады. С полученной прибыли Владимир планирует ремонт в доме.
texts.en:
Vladimir is cultivating vegetables in greenhouses in the town of Kamenka-Dneprovskaya for ten years now. He is growing tomatoes, cucumbers and radishes. Vladimir used to work together with his parents and then he bought himself a house and began farming independently. He is hardworking, works alone and manages everything by himself, he is calm and balanced.

This year Vladimir decided to install heating the greenhouses. He already has a boiler and needs to buy pipes and film to install an air cushion. Besides heating Vladimir needs to restore the greenhouse for the seedlings. He plans to make repairs in his home using the income he will get.

loans.use: to buy pipes and film for heating of greenhouses.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia, age 59, operates a retail business selling jewelry. She sells a variety of jewelry items within her village as well as in the neighboring town. Nelia has been engaged in this enterprise for 18 years and lives in the Binguang province of Isabela. 

Nelia is requesting a loan in order to buy watches, necklaces, earrings, and bracelets to offer for sale through her business.

Nelia's goal is for her business expand so that she can provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy watches, necklaces, earrings, and bracelets to offer for sale
